Text: Animal. Wolf. 2 strikes. May be played keyed to any Wilderness [w] region in Eriador or Wilderland (by name or type), and to Ruins & Lairs [R] in these regions.

Name: Glutan2
Text: Animal. Wolf. 2 strikes. May be played keyed to any Wilderness [w] region in Eriador or Wilderland (by name or type), and to Ruins & Lairs [R] in these regions.

Name: Foe beyond Any of You
Text: Playable on an attack with a normal prowess of 11 or more created by a unique hazard; does not count against the hazard limit. All strikes must be assigned to a leader or to the character in the company with the highest prowess against the attack (defender's choice), regardless of his status or any card effect. Each excess strike gives a -1 modification to the defender's prowess; Pierced by Many Wounds cannot be played on the attack.

Name: Courtesy Lessened of Late
Text: Playable only as an on-guard card. Reveal this card to target and cancel any card or effect that would allow opponent to bring in a character with the company during the site phase.

Name: Leucaruth at Home
Text: Unique. Unless Leucaruth Ahunt is in play, Irerock has an additional automatic-attack: Dragon -- 2 strikes at 17/8. In addition, only one unique Dragon manifestation may be played per turn.

Name: Capricious Spirit
Text: Playable on a Maia, Demon, or Spawn ally. The controlling character must make an influence check against the ally. Make a roll and add the controlling character's unused EI; if the result is lower than the ally's mind +6, discard the ally.

Name: Itangast
Text: Unique. May be played at Gold Hill. Dragon. Three strikes. If Doors of Night is in play, may also be played keyed to Withered Heath, Iron Hills, Northern Rhovanion, Grey Mountain Narrows; may also be played at sites in these regions.

Name: Itangast Ahunt
Text: Unique. Any company moving in Withered Heath, Northern Rhovanion, Iron Hill, and/or Grey Mountain Narrows immediately faces one Dragon attack (considered a hazard creature attack) -- 4 strikes at 16/7. If Doors of Night is in play, this attack also affects: Southern Rhovanion, Dorwinion, Heart of Mirkwood, and Woodland Realm.

Name: Itangast at Home
Text: Unique. Unless Itangast Ahunt is in play, Gold Hill has an additional automatic-attack: Dragon -- 3 strikes at 19/8. In addition, each greater item gives an additional corruption point.

Name: Known to an Ounce
Text: Playable on a site that contains a hoard or on a Dragon at home manifestation. If any item is played at the site or at the site associated with the Dragon at home manifestation, the site's automatic-attacks are again faced. Discard this card when the associated site or Dragon manifestation leaves play. Cannot be duplicated on a given site or Dragon Manifestation.

Name: Land-drake
Text: Drake. One strike. Attacker chooses defending characters.

Name: Left Behind
Text: Playable on a non-Wizard character whose company is facing an attack of five strikes or more. Following the attack, character splits off into a different company with the same site path as the company in which he was. He faces a seperate movement/hazard phase this turn with a hazard limit of one. He may rejoin his original company following all movement/hazard phases.

Name: Lesser Spiders
Text: Spiders. Four strikes.

Name: Black Riders
Text: Playable if Doors of Night is in play. Nazgul creatures may be played against hero companies keyed to Border-land [b], Wilderness [w], and Shadow-land [s]; and to non-Haven, non-Free-hold sites in these regions. Any Nazgul attacking in this fashion is detainment, unless a character in the defending company bears a ring special item. Cannot be duplicated.

Name: Long wailing Cry
Text: Playable on a hero company facing a Nazgul attack. Tap all characters in the company with a mind lower than the number of Nazgul permanent-events in play.

Name: Scorba Ahunt
Text: Unique. Any company moving in Forochel, Angmar, and/or Gundabad immediately faces one Dragon attack (considered a hazard creature attack) -- 4 strikes at 10/7 (attacker chooses defending characters). If Doors of Night is in play, this attack also affects: Numeriador, Arthedain, and Rhudaur.

Name: Sea Serpent
Text: Drake. Two strikes.

Name: Worm's Stench
Text: Playable on a company that has already faced a Dragon or Drake attack this turn. The prowess of each Spider and Animal attack against the company is increased by two for the rest of the turn. Additionally, if Doors of Night is in play, all Wolf attacks receive +2 prowess and all Wolf, Spider, and Animal attacks receive +1 strikes for the rest of the turn against the company.

Name: Tookish Blood
Text: Playable on a Hobbit character. The Hobbit's player must make a roll (or draw a #); return the Hobbit to the player's hand if the result plus his unused general influence is less then 11. If the Hobbit is removed from play, one of his items may be transferred to another character in his company; any other cards under his control are discarded. Alternatively, this card can be played as a resource card. For the rest of the turn, the target Hobbit cannot be discarded or returned to its owner's hand for any reason.

Name: White Wolves
Text: Wolves. Four strikes. May be played keyed to any non- Coastal Sea region in The Northern Waste. May also be played keyed to any region that is a number of regions away from The Northern Waste equal to the number of copies of Bonds of Winter, Fell Winter, Long Winter, and/or Snowstorm in play.

Name: White Vision
Text: Disease. Playable on a character moving in The Northern Waste if Doors of Night is not in play (a non-overt character with a home site in The Northern Waste may tap to cancel this card before it resolves). Target character loses one of his skills (defender's choice; choose the skill when this card resolves). Additionally, for every Snow-blindness played on target character he looses another skill and his company may move one less region (to a minimum of two) Discard this card during any organization phase while target character is at a Haven [H] or at a site not in The Northern Waste. Cannot be duplicated on a given character.

Name: Where the Wargs Howl
Text: Playable on a company that has faced a Wolf attack this turn; does not count against the hazard limit. Any Orc hazard creature may be played against the company this turn, regardless of the company's site path or site.

Name: War-wolves
Text: Wolves. Two strikes. As a creature, may be played at any Ruins & Lairs [R] with a Wolf automatic- attack or any Shadow-hold [S] with an Orc automatic-attack. As a short-event, modify the prowess of an Orc creature attack keyed to a region by +2.

Name: War-wargs
Text: Wolves. Two strikes. As a creature, may be played at any Ruins & Lairs [R] with a Wolf automatic-attack. As a long-event, all Wolf attacks with body have their body modified by +1; and all Wolf attacks with no body have 4 body.

Name: Wolf-riders
Text: Orcs. May be played following any Orc attack not keyed to a site. Three strikes. If played as a short-event, modify the prowess and strikes of a Wolf attack by +1.

Name: Uldor the Accursed
Text: Unique. Undead. May be played at Himring.One strike. If Doors of Night is in play, may be played at any non-Haven, non-Free-hold site in East Bay of Forochel, Elven Shores, Gondalf, Lindon, Minheldolath, Narthalf, or West Bay of Forochel. Weapons do not modify a defender's prowess against the attack (unless Elven Blade is played on the weapon).

Name: The Pack at the Door
Text: Playable if Doors of Night is in play. Non-unique Animal, Spider, and Wolf hazard creatures may be played keyed to Border-lands [b], Border-holds [[B], or Ruins & Lairs [R]. Such creatures must normally be playable keyed to a non-Coastal Sea region. If such a creature is only keyable to regions by name, it may only be played if the company is moving through a region in the same territory as one of the listed regions, or is at a site in such a territory.

Name: Spirit Crime
Text: Corruption. Playable on a character at or moving to a site in The Northern Waste, if he has played a spirit magic resource this turn, or after the successful play of an item at a site with an Undead or Spirit automatic-attack. -1 to all his rolls. Additionally, +1 to his company's hazard limit, and all characters in the company have their CP for transferring items, as well as their rolls for offering attempts, influence attempts, and riddling rolls, modified by -2. Discard this card if bearer discards (for no effect) a rune item he controls, or if opponent has Friends of Winter in play. During the site phase at a Ruins & Lairs [R] in The Northern Waste, a sage in the company may tap and make a roll to attempt to remove this card; if the result is greater than 6, discard this card.

Name: Snow-troll
Text: Troll. Two strikes. May be played keyed to any non-Coastal Sea region in The Northern Waste; and also at Ruins & Lairs [R] in these regions. Attacker chooses defending characters, unless the defending company contains a ranger. If Bonds of Winter or Fell Winter is in play, Snow-troll may be played keyed to any region in The Northern Waste and its adjacent regions.

Name: Snow-lion
Text: Animal. One strike. Attacker chooses defending characters. May be played keyed to any Wilderness [w] region in The Northern Waste, and to its adjacent regions if Bonds of Winter or Fell Winter is in play. May only be played against a company with three characters or less. +2 prowess if the company contains only one character or a Hobbit. +1 to any resulting body checks. Scout only resources do not affect Snow-lion and this card cancels any ongoing effect of such resources.

Name: Snow-elves
Text: Elves. Four strikes. Detainment and -2 prowess againsthero companies. May be played keyed to Dor Bendor, Everdalf, Lindalf, Talath Oiohelka, Talath Uichel, or Thorenaer; and at non-Haven sites in these regions. If Helecthil, Light of the North is in play, may be keyed to any region in The Northern Waste. If all characters in the company face a strike from Snow-elves and if all are strikes are successful, the company must immediately return to their site of origin.

Name: Snow-blindness
Text: Disease. Playable on a character moving in The Northern Waste. Make a roll for the character, modified by +2 if he does not have a home site in The Northern Waste, and by +1 for every Wilderness [w] in The Northern Waste in his site path. If the result is greater than target character's body, place this card on him; otherwise discard this card. Character receives -2 prowess and looses any scout and ranger skills. aTap a ranger in his company and discard from hand or play (for nor effect) a card with a healing effect to discard this card. Cannot be duplicated on a given character.

Name: Snow in the Mountains
Text: Environment. Playable on a company moving through Angmar, Gundabad, High Pass, Withered Heath, or any mountain region. If Bonds of Winter or Fell Winter is in play, may also be played on a company moving through Redhorn Gate, Grey Mountain Narrows, or Iron Hills. Each non-Elf character in the company makes a roll and adds his base prowess. If the result is less than 8, the character taps. If he was already tapped, the company must immediately return to its site of origin. Cannot be duplicated on given company unless Bonds of Winter and Fell Winter are both in play.

Name: True Spirits of the North Winds
Imagefile: True Spirits of the North Winds.jpg
Text: Unique. Maia. 3 strikes. Attacker chooses defending characters. Detainment against hero and covert companies. May be played keyed to any non-Shadow-land region (and non-Wilderness region if Mordo is in play) in The Northern Waste. May always be played against a company that contains Eloeklo, Demon of the North Wind and is at or moving to a site in The Northern Waste. This card may also be played (at any time) as a resource, to cancel an attack by Eloeklo, Lindor's Bane, or to cancel CvCC if Eloeklo, Demon of the North Wind is in the attacking company.

Name: Scorba at Home
Text: Unique. Unless Scorba Ahunt is in play, Zarak Dum has an additional automatic-attack: Dragon -- 3 strikes at 13/8. In addition, each major item gives an additional corruption point.

Name: Withered Lands
Text: Environment. Playable only if Doors of Night is in play. Treat one target Wilderness [{w}] as two Wildernesses [{w}] or one Shadow-land [{s}] as two Wildernesses [{w}] or one Border-land [{b}] as two Wildernesses [{w}] until the end of the turn.

Name: Winged Cold-drake
Text: Drake. Two Strikes. Attacker chooses defending characters. Three wildernesses [{w}] in site path are required.

Name: Searching Eye
Text: Cancel any card requiring scout skill before it is resolved or cancel any ongoing effect of a card that required scout skill to play. If this card is played as an on-guard card, it can be revealed during opponent's site phase to cancel a card requiring scout skill.

Name: Shadow of Mordor
Text: Environment. The hazard limit for each company is increased by one for every card over one drawn by that company during its movement/hazard phase. Additionally, if Doors of Night is in play, during each company's movement/hazard phase, the hazard player may draw one additional card for every card in excess of one drawn by his opponent. Cannot be duplicated.

Name: Sleepless Malice
Text: One Undead hazard creature against each company doesn't count against its hazard limit. Additionally, if Doors of Night is in play, any Undead hazard creature may be played keyed to Ruins and Lairs. Cannot be duplicated.

Name: Smaug Ahunt
Text: Unique. Any company moving in Withered Heath, Northern Rhovanion, Iron Hills, and/or Grey Mountain Narrows immediately faces one Dragon attack (considered a hazard creature attack) -- 3 strikes at 15/7 (attacker chooses defending character). If Doors of Night is in play, this attack also affects: Brown Lands, Southern Rhovanion, Dorwinion, Dagorland, and Horse Plains.

Name: Smaug at Home
Text: Unique. Unless Smaug Ahunt is in play, The Lonely Mountain has an additional automatic-attack: Dragon -- 2 strikes at 18/8. In addition, each moving company draws one less card to minimum of one at the start of its movement/hazard phase.

Name: Song of the Lady
Text: Song. At the end of the organization phase, each company at Lorien that wishes to move must make a roll (or draw a #). This roll is modified by: -1 if company contains any Men, -1 if company contains any Hobbits, +2 if company contains any Dwarves. If the result is less than 7, the company may not move this turn.

Name: Stormcrow
Text: The direct influence of each Wizard is reduced by 2 (by 4 if Doors of Night is in play). Discard all resource permanent-events that have been played on each company with a Wizard (i.e., on the company as a whole, not individual characters, e.g., Fellowship). No such cards may be played on each Wizard's company. Discard this card when any play deck is exhausted. Cannot be duplicated. May not be played on a lord player.

Name: Winged Fire-drake
Text: Drake. Two strikes. Attacker chooses defending characters. Three Wildernesses [{w}] or two Shadow-lands [{s}] in site path are required.

Name: Subtlety of Guile
Text: The body of one non-Wizard character wounded by a Dragon attack is lowered by 1 until the end of the turn. Alternatively, lowers the body of one non-Wizard character wounded by a manifestation of Itangast by 2 until the end of the turn, or lowers the body of each non-Wizard character in a company facing an attack by a manifestation of Itangast by one until the end of the turn. Cannot be duplicated on a given character or company.

Name: Times Are Evil
Text: All offering attempts and influence attempts are modified by - 3.

Name: True Cold-drake
Text: Drake. Two strikes. May be played keyed to Numeriador, Forochel, Angmar, Gundabad, Grey Mountain Narrows, Withered Heath, and Iron Hills. {green} DCE: Two strikes. May be played keyed to Numeriador, Forochel, Grey Mountain Narrows, Withered Heath, Iron Hills, any non-coastal sea region in the Northern Waste.

Name: True Fire-drake
Text: Drake. Two strikes. Three Wildernesses [{w}] in site path are required (only two Wildernesses [{w}] are required if Doors of Night is in play).

Name: Velocity of Haste
Text: A Dragon attack receives one additional strike (with no body). Alternatively, an attack from a manifestation of Scorba receives two additional strikes (each with no body).

Name: Were-worm
Text: Drake. One strike. Attacker chooses defending characters. Defending company must discard one item of attacker's choice for each character wounded by Were-worm. Three Wildernesses [{w}] in site path are required.

Name: Wild Fell Beast
Text: Drake. Three strikes. Attacker chooses defending characters. Unless this attack is cancelled, all untapped characters in defending company are tapped following attack. Two Shadow-lands [{s}] in site path are required.

Name: Winds of Wrath
Text: Playable only if Doors of Night is in play. Replace the new site card of a moving company with a Coastal Sea [{c}] in its site path with a card from your location deck that has a Coastal Sea [{c}] in its site path.

Name: Thunder's Companion
Text: Giants. Three strikes. Two Wildernesses [{w}] in site path are required.

Name: Lure of the Rings
Text: All hero characters bearing a gold ring item mustmake a CP at the beginning of their movement/ hazard phase. This CP is modified by -6 when moving through Gorgoroth or a Dark-Domain [d]. Cannot be duplicated.

Name: Memories Grown Dim
Text: Any company that intends to play a Lost Knowledgecard, or fullfil the requirement of Lost Knowledge being discarded, must tap a sage (before any other requirements). Discard this card when any play deck is exhausted. Cannot be duplicated.

Name: No Memory of This Place
Text: Cancels the effects of Secret Entrance and Forewarned is Forearmed. Additionally, each company intending to move with Under-deeps movement must make an Under-deeps movement roll for each adjacent site during their organization phase. This is done before a new site is selected and instead of during the movement/hazard phase. Such a roll is modified by -3, but if successful the site may be taken from location deck or discard pile. Discard this card when any play deck is exhausted. Cannot be duplicated.

Name: Panic
Text: Playable on a company facing a non-detainment Demon, Dragon, Drake, Undead, or Spawn attack (does not count against the hazard limit). May be revealed as an on-guard card when the company faces such an attack. For every ally in the company (except allies of the above named types or maia allies), make a roll adding its mind (+2 if unique) and its controlling character's mind. If the result is less than the attack's prowess, the ally is tapped; if less than the attack's prowess minus 7, discard the ally.

Name: Out of the Swamps
Text: Any non-unique Undead hazard creature may be played keyed to a swamp. Additionally, if it is normally keyable to a swamp, or if Doors of Night is in play, any non-unique Undead hazard creature may be played keyed to the region containing a swamp. Discard at the end of the movement/hazard phase if such a creature was played keyed (by name) to a swamp or region containing a swamp.

Name: Much Cursing and Confusion
Text: Play to target a card opponent has reserved face down or has placed "off to the side" (cannot be a character or agent); opponent must reveal target card and bring it to his hand, or place this card in his mp. For each copy of this card in his mp, a player's hand size is reduced by 1 for the purpose of resolving hand size after any movement/hazard phase.

Name: Mewlips
Text: Undead. Two strikes. May also be played at any swamp. Any character wounded by Mewlips must discard one non-ring item he bears (defender's choice). If Mewlips is defeated, a character in the company may tap to play a minor or major item, which may be taken from your hand or discard pile.

Name: Mensharag
Text: Pukel-creature. Animal. Two strikes. May not be played if the company has already faced a hazard creature this movement/hazard phase. Any subsequent hazard creatures played keyed to the same site cost two against the hazard limit. May also be played at Ruins & Lairs [R] sites in the following regions: Andrast, Anfalas, Anorien, Dunland, Enedhwaith, Gap of Isen, Lamedon, Old Pukel Gap, Old Pukel-land, and Rohan.

Name: Memories of Axe-wielders
Text: Playable on a company containing a majority of Man, Dwarf, Orc and/or Troll characters. All Awakened Plant attacks against the company receive +2 prowess this turn. Cannot be duplicated in a given phase.

Name: Lost in Emyn Muil
Text: Playable on a moving company. Opponent must discard the top card of his play deck (he may look at the card) or bring a number of random cards equal to the company size from his discard pile to his play deck and shuffle (hazard player's choice). Opponent may cancel the second effect by shuffling the same number of random cards from his hand to his play deck instead. Remove this card from the game.

Name: Tauremornalome
Text: As a permanent-event, each player may use one against the hazard limit to discard an Awakened Plant creature from hand and add one Wilderness [w] to the site path of a company moving through at least one Wilderness or Border-land [b]. A ranger, avatar, or Ent in the company may tap to cancel this effect. Additionally, each overt company (or company containing a Dwarf and no Elf or Wizard) and moving through Fangorn, Lotan, Old Forest, or Usakan, faces an attack: Awakened Plants -- 3 strikes with 10 rowess. Cannot be duplicated as a permanent-event.As a short-event, play to tap one Ent.

Name: Lord of the Eorlingas
Text: Unique. Manifestation of Theoden. Man. Two strikes. As a creature, may be played keyed to Anorien, Enedwaith, Gap of Isen, and Rohan; and at sites in these regions. Detainment against hero and covert companies. If played as a permanent-event, it will remain in play until tapped during opponent's movement/hazard phase (tapping counts against the hazard limit). When tapped, it becomes a long-event:, any company without a horse ally and at a site in the above named regions cannot reveal a new site that is not in the above named regions (unless it uses flying movement).

Name: King of the Dead
Text: Unique. Undead. Manifestation of Oathbreaker. One strike. May be played keyed to Dunland, Enedhwaith, Gap of Isen, Old Pukel Gap, or Old Pukel-land; and also at Ruins & Lairs [R] in these regions and at Dunharrow or Vale of Erech. Each character wounded by King of the Dead makes a CP modified by -1. Cannot be played if opponent has Army of the Dead in play.

Name: Hurnkennec
Text: Pukel-creature. Spider. One strike. Attacker chooses defending characters. May not be played if the company has already faced a hazard creature this movement/hazard phase. Any subsequent hazard creatures played keyed to the same site cost two against the hazard limit. May also be played at Ruins & Lairs [R] sites in the following regions: Andrast, Anfalas, Anorien, Dunland, Enedhwaith, Gap of Isen, Lamedon, Old Pukel Gap, Old Pukel-land, and Rohan.

Name: Hunt Wild Men Like Beasts
Text: Characters with a home site in Rohan may not be in the same company as a Wose character. Additionally, characters with a home site in Rohan may initiate CvCC with a Wose character or ally, as if both are single character companies and regardless of their alignment.

Name: Haunted Place
Text: Playable on a Ruins & Lairs [R] or Shadow-hold [S] in a region affected by Angmar Arrises, Growing Shadow, In Darkness Bind Them, or Reaching Shadow. An additional automatic- attack is created at the site: Undead -- 2 strikes with 7 prowess. Alternatively, as a short-event, playable on a site with an Undead automatic-attack. The automatic-attack cannot be cancelled this turn.

Name: Grima Wormtongue
Text: Unique. Man. Manifestation of Wormtongue. One strike. Detainment against hero and covert companies. As a creature, may be played at any site in Anorien, Dunland, Enedwaith, Rohan, or Gap of Isen. May also be played following an attack by Saruman the Wise. Unless this attack is cancelled or defeated, tap all non-diplomat, non-sage characters in the company. If played as a long-event, all influence attempts at sites in the above named regions are modified by -3.

Name: Greater Spectres
Text: Undead. Two strikes. May also be played at any Dungeon. Non-unique weapons do not modify a defender's prowess against strikes from Greater Spectres. Unless the attack was defeated, immediately afterwards opponent may play a corruption card (taken from his hand or discard pile) on a character who has faced a strike from the attack (if the conditions to play it exist; does not count against the hazard limit).

Name: Greater Spectres2
Text: Undead. 2 strikes. May also be played at any Under- deeps site with an Undead automatic-attack. Non-unique weapons do not modify a defender's prowess against strikes from Greater Spectres. Unless the attack was cancelled, after the attack opponent may search his discard pile for one corruption card and play it on a character that has faced a strike from the attack (if the conditions to play it exist; does not count against the hazard limit).

Name: Like Shreds of Cloud
Text: Weapons (except weapons with a resource event attached) do not modify a defending character's prowess against strikes from Chill Douser, Corpse Candle, Ghosts, Sand Devil, Ta-Fa-Lish, or Wisp of Pale Sheen. Discard when any play deck is exhausted. Cannot be duplicated.

Name: Greater Specters
Text: Undead. 2 strikes. May also be played at any Under- deeps site with an Undead automatic-attack. Non-unique weapons do not modify a defender's prowess against strikes from Greater Specters. Unless the attack was cancelled, after the attack opponent may search his discard pile for one corruption card and play it on a character that has faced a strike from the attack (if the conditions to play it exist; does not count against the hazard limit).

Name: Terror of Halifirien
Text: Unique. Animal. Boar. Trophy. Manifestation of Wild Boar of Everhold. One strike. Playable keyed to Rohan and Fangorn. May also be played at Druadan Forest. If Terror of Halifirien is defeated and a Man character has faced one of its strikes, he may take it as a trophy: the character receives +1EI and +1 prowess.

Name: Turukulon's New Abode
Text: Unique. Manifestation of Turukulon. Place this card with a non-Dragon's Lair Ruins & Lairs [R] in a mountain region or with at least 3 Wildernesses [w] or 2 Deserts [e] in its site path (not in Mirkwood); the site may also be taken from your location deck. Target site does not leave active play until this card leaves play. Any version of the site gains an additional automatic- attack: Dragon -- 3 strikes with 12/7 prowess/body. This card is considered an at home manifestation; it cannot be revealed as an on-guard card.

Name: Cult of the Eye
Text: Cult. Playble on a minion Man or Dunadan faction if Doors of Night is in play. Any influence attempt by a hero player against the faction is modified by -2. Additionally, all Border-holds [B] and Free-holds [F] in the region containing the site where the faction was played gain an (additional) automatic- attack: Men -- 2 strikes with 10 prowess (detainment against black players' companies and/or if the resource player has a faction in play at a site in the region). Cannot be duplicated on a given faction.

Name: Bitter Heirlooms
Text: Corruption. Playable on a Lord avatar. +1 to his P.A Dwarf-lord also receives 2 corruption points. Target Lord must make a roll during the organization phase if not at a Haven [H], modified by -4 if his P total exceeds 5, -6 if it exceeds 10, -8 if it exceeds 15, or -10 if it exceeds 20. If the result is 0 or less, he must move to a different site that turn. Cannot be duplicated on a given character. Discard during the organization phase if bearer is at a Haven.

Name: Beacons Alight
Text: All sites in Gondor receive an additional automatic-attack: Men -- 3 strikes with 8 prowess (detainment against hero and covert companies). Additionally, each player may bring a Dunadan hazard creature from his discard pile to his play deck (reshuffle) during the end-of-turn phase.

Name: Agburanar Ahunt
Text: Unique. Any company moving in Withered Heath, Northern Rhovanion, Iron Hills, and/or Grey Mountain Narrows immediately faces one Dragon attack (considered a hazard creature attack) -- 3 strikes at 13/8. If Doors of Night is in play, this attack also affects: Southern Rhovanion, Dorwinion, Heart of Mirkwood, and Woodland Realm.

Name: Agburanar at Home
Text: Unique. Unless Agburanar Ahunt is in play, Caves of Ulund has an additional automatic-attack: Dragon -- 2 strikes at 16/9. In addition, one unique Dragon manifestation played against each company does not count against the hazard limit.

Name: Bairanax
Text: Unique. Winged. May be played at Ovir Hollow. Dragon. Two strikes. Attacker chooses defending characters. If Doors of Night is in play, may also be played keyed to Withered Heath, Gundabad, Anduin Vales, and Grey Mountain Narrows; may also be played at sites in these regions.

Name: Bairanax Ahunt
Text: Unique. Any company moving in Withered Heath, Gundabad, Anduin Vales, and/or Grey Mountain Narrows immediately faces one Dragon attack (considered a hazard creature attack) -- 3 strikes at 12/6 (attacker chooses defending characters). If Dooors of Night is in play, this attack also affects: Northern Rhovanion, Iron Hills, Southern Rhovanion, and Angmar.

Name: Turukulon
Text: Unique. Fire-dragon. May be played at Turukulon's Lair. Three strikes. If Doors of Night is in play, may also be played keyed to Dunland, Enedwaith, Hollin, Misty Mountains - Southern Spur, and Redhorn Gate; and at non-Haven, non-Free-hold sites in these regions.

Name: Bairanax at Home
Text: Unique. Unless Bairanax Ahunt is in play, Ovir Hollow has an additional automatic-attack: Dragon -- 2 strikes at 15/7. In addition, the hazard limit against any company facing one or more animal hazard creature attacks is increased by one.

Name: Carrion Birds
Text: May be played keyed to wilderness after any Orc, Troll, or Man attack keyed to wilderness and against the same company. Animals. Each character in the company faces one strike. Any character wounded by Carrion Birds makes two body checks instead of one, both checks modified by -1.

Name: Cave Worm
Text: Drake. One strike. May be played keyed to Redhorn Gate, High Pass, Gap of Isen, Angmar, Gundabad, Grey Mountain Narrows, Withered Heath, Numeriador, Iron Hills, Dragon Gap, or any mountain region {m}. {green} DCE: May also be played keyed to Narthalf, Azjan, Uzek Jan, Dragon Gap.

Name: Cruel Caradhras
Text: Playable on a company using region movement to move through one of the following regions (and not stopping at a site therein): High Pass, Redhorn Gate, Angmar, Gundabad, Grey Mountain Narrows, or Imlad Morgul. Each character in target company must face one strike (not an attack) of 8 prowess which cannot be cancelled. Any resulting body check is modified by +1.

Name: Daelomin Ahunt
Text: Unique. Any company moving in Withered Heath, Northern Rhovanion, Iron Hills, and/or Grey Mountain Narrows immediately faces one Dragon attack (considered a hazard creature attack) -- 4 strikes at 11/7 (attacker chooses defending characters). If Doors of Night is in play, this attack also affects: Brown Lands, Southern Rhovanion, Dorwinion, Dagorlad, and Horse Plains.

Name: Daelomin at Home
Text: Unique. Unless Daelomin Ahunt is in play, Dancing Spire has an additional auto-attack: Dragon -- 3 strikes at 14/8. In addition, you may discard this card from play during opponent's movement/hazard phase (not counting against the hazard limit) to increase the hazard limit against one company by two.

Name: Deftness of Agility
Text: A Dragon can assign a strike (with a -3 modification to it's prowess) to a character already assigned to receive one of its strikes. Alternatively, a manifestation of Bairanax can direct such a strike with no prowess modification.

Name: We Wants It!
Text: Reveal your My Precious at a site where a company containing Gollum or Stinker is present: Gollum/Stinker immediately attacks a character in the company bearing an item (your choice). After the attack, if the attack was successfull, discard Gollum/Stinker. Otherwise, turn My Precious face down and heal Gollum/Stinker (if still in play).

Name: Black Breath
Text: Corruption. Disease. Place with any wounded character in a company that just faced a Nazgul attack; the character receives 3 corruption points. Target character makes a body check during each of his organization phases. Whenever target creature would normally heal, he instead makes a roll (or draws a #): if the result is greater than 10, he heals normally and this card is removed. The roll is modified by +2 if the character is at a Haven{H} and by +2 for each sage in his company that taps in support.

Name: Grasping and Ungracious
Text: Corruption. Playable on a non-diplomat, non-avatar character. Target character may not transfer or store any items, and no items may be transferred to target character. Cannot be duplicated on a given character. During his organization phase, a character with this card may tap to attempt to remove it. Make a roll: if the result is greater 6, discard this card.

Name: Devastation
Text: Playable on a site on which Nature's Revenge, Siege, or Wyrmsiege was in play at the beginning of the movement/ hazard phase. Discard the above mentioned hazard(s) from the site. Any version of the site becomes a Ruins & Lairs [R] and the region containing it a Wilderness [w]. Replace all its automatic-attacks with: Undead -- 3 strikes with 7 prowess. Additionally, the site never untaps and does not leave active play. Discard this card if the site becomes a Haven [H] or Rebuild the Town or Hold Rebuilt and Repaired is played it.

Name: Demons of Aglarond
Text: Demons. Four strikes. May be played at Glittering Caves and The Gem-deeps. If Doors of Night is in play, may also be played keyed to any Under-deeps site adjacent to these sites and to Gap of Isen; and also at any Under-deeps site with a Demon or Spawn automatic-attack.

Name: Ice-drake
Text: Drake. Two strikes. May be played keyed to Elven Shores, Forochel, Angmar, Gundabad, Grey Mountain Narrows, and Withered Heath. {green} DCE: Two strikes. May be played keyed to any region in the Northern Waste and Elven Shores.

Name: Icy Touch
Text: The prowess of one Undead attack is modified by +1. Corruption. The next character wounded by the attack (on whom a corruption card has not already been played this turn) receives 2 corruption points (place this card with the character). Discard Icy Touch if it is not played with a character. During his organization phase, a character with this card may tap and attempt to remove it. Make a roll (or draw a #): if this result is greater than a 6, discard this card.

Name: Incite Denizens
Text: Creates an additional automatic-attack at a Ruins & Lairs [{R}] until the end of the turn. This is an exact duplicate (including all existing and eventual modifications to prowess, etc.) of an existing automatic-attack of your choice at the site. This automatic-attack is faced after the automatic-attack it duplicates. Cannot be duplicated on a given site.

Name: Incite Minions
Text: Creates an additional automatic-attack at a Shadow-hold [{S}] or Dark-hold [{D}] until the end of the turn. This is an exact duplicate (including all existing and eventual modifications to prowess, etc.) of an existing automatic-attack of your choice at the site. This automatic-attack is faced after the automatic-attack it duplicates. Cannot be duplicated on a given site.

Name: Until All Else Is Conquered
Text: Playable on a Haven [H] if the bearer of The One Ring is there. Any non-minion company at the site faces 3 attacks (cannot be cancelled by any card effect) at the beginning of the site phase: Orcs -- 5 strikes with 8 prowess; Trolls-- 3 strikes 10 prowess; Nazgul -- 2 strikes with 13 prowess. Discard The One Ring if any strike against its bearer is successful. If all attacks are defeated, place this card in opponents mp. The bearer of The One Ring cannot leave the site while this card is in play. Cannot be duplicated.

Name: Thrice Told Tales
Text: Playable on a sage. Target loses the sage skill. Discard this card if his company moves with at least two regions in their site path or to a non-Haven Under-deeps site.

Name: The Ring Has Moved On
Text: Playable on a ring. Rotate this card 90deg (or add a token) each time target character faces a strike. At the end of his movement/hazard phase target character makes a CP, modified by subtracting the number of times this card is rotated (or number of tokens); If he fails the CP, discard the ring (ignore any other effects) and remove this card from the game. Otherwise, restore this card (remove the tokens). Cannot be duplicated on a given ring.

Name: Host of Bats
Text: Against each company, one Orc hazard creature may be played that does not count towards the hazard limit. Any character wounded by an Orc attack makes an additional body check modified by -1. Additionally, if Shadow of Mordor is in play, any character wounded by an attack keyed to (or an automatic-attack at) a Shadow-hold [{S}] or a Dark-hold [{D}] makes an additional body check modified by -2. Cannot be duplicated.

Name: The Old Villain
Text: Playable on My Precious. -1 to My Precious' prowess and he may not be turned face down. If he was at the same site of an opponent's company during the organization phase, he may take one agent action to move to that company's new site (if allowed to move there). If a company controlling a ring or treasure item enters his current site, My Precious must attack during the site phase. Discard this card if My Precious attacks and is not successful.

Name: Speak, Friend, and Enter!
Text: Playable on a Shadow-hold [S], Dark-hold [D],or hidden site against a moving hero company. Cannot be revealed as an on-guard card. Unless the company contains a sage or a Hobbit, or you discard a Knowledge or Information card from hand or the company, the company must do nothing during the site phase. Additionally, cancels the effects of Crack in the Wall and Secret Entrance.

Name: Seized upon the Bearer
Text: Attacking hazard creatures may assign strikesto any hero ringbearer before other strikes are assigned. If such a strike is assigned to the bearer of The One Ring, the strike receives +2 prowess.

Name: Rangers at Sarn Ford
Text: Dunedain. 5 strikes. Only playable against minion companies. May be played keyed to Arthedain, Cardolan, Old Forest, or The Shire. +2 prowess against Ringwraiths.

Name: No Place for a Pony
Text: Playable on a horse ally. Discard the ally if its company enters a Shadow-hold [S] or Dark-hold [D] this turn, or is moving to an Under-deeps site or Dungeon. Cannot be revealed as an on-guard card.

Name: No Memory of This Place2
Text: Cancels the effects of Down Down to Goblin Town, Secret Entrance, Secret Passage, and Forewarned is Forearmed. Additionally, all Under-deeps movement rolls are modified by -3, and one scout may tap to give +2 to his company's next Under-deeps movement roll; after a successful Under-deeps movement roll, the resource player may take one resource event from his discard pile or play deck (reshuffle) to his hand. Cannot be duplicated.

Name: No Memory of This Place3
Text: Cancels the effects of Down Down to Goblin Town, Secret Entrance, Secret Passage, and Forewarned is Forearmed. Alternatively, playable on a company. All of the company's Under-deeps movement rolls are modified by -3; a scout may tap to give +2 to his company's next Under-deeps movement roll. After a successful Under-deeps movement roll, the resource player may discard this card or take one resource from his discard pile or play deck (reshuffle) to his hand. Cannot be duplicated on a given company.

Name: No Memory of This Place4
Text: Cancels the effects of Down Down to Goblin Town, Secret Entrance, Secret Passage, and Forewarned is Forearmed. Alternatively, playable on a company. All rolls for the company (or any associated entity) for Under-deeps movement or burglary attempts are modified by -3, but a scout in the company may tap to give +2 to such a roll. After such a roll, if it was successful, the resource player may discard this card or search his play deck for one resource and take it to his hand (reshuffle if searched). This card cannot be duplicated for each of its uses.

Name: Taint of the Wilds
Text: Corruption. Playable on a non-avatar ranger. Target character receives 1 corruption point and makes a CP when a character in his company uses a resource requiring the ranger skill. During the organization phase at his home site or a Haven [H] (or site that acts as a Haven for the purpose of healing), the character may tap to attempt to remove this card and make a roll: if the result is greater than 6, discard this card. Cannot be duplicated on a given character.

Name: Hobgoblins
Text: Orcs. Two strikes. Two Wildernesses [{w}] in site path are required.

Name: Half an Eye Open
Text: Playable on a Dragon or Drake attack (before the strikes are assigned). Attacker may choose defending non-Wizard character to face the first strike assigned from the attack. Alternatively, it may be revealed as an on-guard card when a burglary attempt is announced -- this attempt is modified by -5.

Name: Gothmog
Text: Unique. Troll. One strike. May also be played following an Orc or Troll attack in a Shadow-land [{s}] or Shadow-hold [{S}].

Name: Darkness Ahead
Text: Once per turn, any hazard player may reserve a card face down with this card (counting as 1 against the hazard limit). Only one card can be reserved with this card at any time. During any of opponent's movement/hazard phases, the hazard player may play his reserved card as though it were in his hand. During opponent's end-of-turn phase, a player may take his reserved card back into his hand. When this card is discarded, reveal and discard any card reserved with it: if the revealed card was not a hazard, its controlling player receives this card in his mp. -1 to your hand size if this card is in your mp. Cannot be duplicated by a given player.

Name: All Dead, All Rotten
Text: Each non-Elf, non-Wizard character in a company moving to a site with an Undead automatic-attack must make a CP at the end of their movement/ hazard phase. Additionally, Corpse-candle, Ghouls, and Wisp of Pale Sheen can be played at any swamp. Discard when any play deck is exhausted. Cannot be duplicated.

Name: Dire Wolves
Text: Wolves. Four strikes. Two Wildernesses [{w}] in site path are required.

Name: Dragon-sickness
Text: Playable on a character bearing a major or greater item. Character makes a corruption check modified by -1.

Name: Dragon's Blood
Text: Playable on a character facing a Dragon or Drake strike (before the dice are rolled to resolve the strike). If the strike fails, the target character must make a body check modified by -1 if he has armor, by -1 if he has a shield, and by -1 if he has a helmet. Cannot be duplicated on a given character.

Name: Dragon's Breath
Text: Playable on an attack by a True Fire-drake, by a Winged Fire-drake, or by any manifestation of Itangast, Leucaruth, Scorba, or Smaug (must be played before strikes are assigned). Each character in the company being attacked must immediately face one strike equal to the attack's prowess. Instead or using prowess against the strike, each character uses his body modified by +1 if he has a shield, by +1 is he has a helmet, and by +3 if he taps. The target attack which follows receives +1 body and -2 prowess. Cannot be duplicates on a given attack.

Name: Dragon's Curse
Text: Corruption. Dark enchantment. Playable on a non-Wizard character facing a strike from a Dragon hazard creature attack. The strike's prowess is modified by -1. The character recieves 2 corruption points. The target character makes a corruption check at the end of his untap phase. Cannot be duplicated on a given character. During his organization phase, a sage in the target character's company may tap to attempt to remove this card. Make a roll (or draw a #): if this result is greater than 6, discard this card.

Name: Dragon's Terror
Text: Dark enchantment. Playable on a Dragon or Drake hazard creature attack before the strikes are assigned. For each card you discard from your hand when Dragon's Terror is declared, target one non-Wizard character of your choice in the defending company and make a roll (or draw a #)--add +2 for a Dragon attack. If the result is greater than the character's mind, the character taps. Each card discarded in this fashion counts as one against the company's hazard limit.

Name: Dunlending Raiders
Text: Men. Five strikes. Playable keyed to Enedhwaith, Cardolan, Hollin, Rhudar, and Dunland; and may also be played at Ruins & Lairs [{R}] in these regions.

Name: Earcaraxe
Text: Unique. May be played at Isle of the Ulond. Dragon. Two strikes. Attacker chooses defending characters. If Doors of Night is in play, may also be played keyed to Andrast Coast, Bay of Belfalas, Eriadoran Coast, and Andrast; and may also be played at sites in these regions.

Name: Earcaraxe Ahunt
Text: Unique. Any company moving in Andrast Coast, Bay of Belfalas, Eriadoran Coast, and/or Andrast immediately faces one Dragon attack (considered a hazard creature attack) -- 3 strikes at 15/6 (attacker chooses defending characters). If Doors of Night is in play, this attack also affects: Old Pukel-land, Enedhwaith, Anfalas, and any Coastal Sea [{c}] region (or region type).

Name: Earcaraxe at Home
Text: Unique. Unless Earcaraxe Ahunt is in play, Isle of the Ulond has an additional automatic-attack: Dragon -- 2 strikes at 18/7 (attacker chooses defending characters), In addition, the hazard limit against any moving company with a Coastal Sea [{c}] region in its site path is increased by one.

Name: Exile of Solitude
Text: One strike of an at home manifestation of any unique Dragon can attempt to capture a non-Wizard character. This strike's prowess is modified by -1. If this strike is successful, it forces the discard of the character (with no body check) and all cards he controls. Alternatively, all strikes of Earcaraxe at Home attempt to capture all non-Wizard characters defending against her strikes.

Name: Fever of Unrest
Text: A Dragon hazard creature can attack a company with four Wildernesses [{w}] in its site path. Alternatively, Leucaruth can attack a company with three Wildernesses [{w}] in her site path.

Name: Foolish Words
Text: Any riddling roll, offering attempt, or influence attempt by the target character is modified by -4. If placed on-guard, it may be revealed and played when a character in the company declares a riddling, offering, or influence attempt. During his organization phase, a character with this card may tap to attempt to remove it. Make a roll (or draw a #): if this result is greater than 7, discard this card. Cannot be duplicated on a given character.

Name: Frenzy of Madness
Text: Playable on a Shadow-hold [{S}] not in Gorgoroth, Nurn, Udun, or Imlad Morgul. If you discard (from your hand) a hazard creature playable at the site, one Dragon hazard creature may be played this turn keyed to the site. Alternatively, Daelomin may be played at the site this turn (without discarding a creature).

Name: From the Pits of Angband
Text: At the end of each turn, each player may take one unique Dragon manifestation or one Drake hazard creature from his discard pile and shuffle it into his play deck. Alternatively, if Doors of Night is in play, at the end of each turn, each player may return one unique Dragon manifestation and/or one Drake hazard creature from his discard pile to his hand. Cannot be duplicated.

Name: Dunadan Explorers
Text: Dunedain. 3 strikes. Detainment against hero and covert companies. May also be played keyed to Bay of Belfalas, Coast of Harad, and Mouths of the Anduin. If Gates of Morning or Sun is in play, may also be played keyed to any port and to any Free-domain [f] or Border-land [b] adjacent to a Coastal Sea [c] region.

Name: Traitor
Text: When the next character fails a corruption check, he becomes a traitor and an attack is immediately made against a character in the traitor's company. The character to be attacked is chosen by the player who does not control the traitor's company. The prowess of the attack is equal to the prowess of the traitor plus 10. Any resulting body check is modified by +1. This card is  discarded when a character fails his corruption check.

Name: Stench of Mordor
Text: Environment. At the start of its site phase, each company at a site in a Dark-domain [{d}] (or Shadow-land [{s}], if Doors of Night is in play) must tap one untapped character if available. Discard when any play deck is exhausted. Cannot be duplicate

Name: Uvatha the Horseman
Text: Unique. Nazgul (9th). May be played as a hazard creature (with one strike) or as a permanent-event. As a creature, may also be played keyed to Harondor, Horse Plains, Gorgoroth, and Khand; and may also be played at sites in these regions. If played as a permanent-event, it will remain in play until tapped during the opponent's movement/hazard phase (tapping counts against the hazard limit). When tapped, Uvatha the Horseman becomes a short-event and you may bring one hazard creature from your discard pile to your hand. {green}  DCE: As a creature, may also be played keyed to Gap of Khand, Horse Plains, Gorgoroth, and Khand; and may also be played at sites in these regions.

Name: The Oldest
Text: Unique. Maia. Manifestation of Tom Bombadil. Two strikes. Detainment and -3 prowess against hero and non- Ringwraith covert companies. As a creature, may be played keyed to Old Forest; or at sites in this region; may also be played at Barrow-downs. Ring abilities cannot cancel a strike or attack from The Oldest. As a permanent-event, no minion or overt company may move to a site in Old Forest. You may return The Oldest as a permanent-event to your hand, which counts as one against the hazard limit.

Name: The Watchful Peace
Text: Each player may bring one Maia hazard permanent- event from his discard pile to his play deck (reshuffle) during the end-of-turn phase. Additionally, if Doors of Night is not in play, hazard creatures which are manifestations of a Wizard or Elf-lord may be played keyed to Border-land [b], Border-hold [B] or Wilderness [w] against minion and overt companies; and also at Ruins & Lairs [R] if such company contains a ring. Cannot be duplicated.

Name: Tree-herder
Text: Awakened Plant. One strike. Detainment if the company contains an Elf, Hobbit, or Wizard (not a Fallen- wizard). May also be played following an attack from a unique Awakened Plant creature against the company this turn, or at a site with Nature's Revenge. Unless Tree-herder's attack is defeated, the hazard player may reveal the top ten cards of his play deck: one revealed Awakened Plant creature of attacker's choice immediately attacks the company (shuffle the remaining cards back into the play deck).

Name: Wrath of the Olvar
Text: All Awakened Plant attacks receive +1 strike and attacker chooses defending characters. Cannot be duplicated.

Name: Yavanna's Plea
Text: All Awakened Plant attacks with body have their body modified by +1. All Awakened Plant attacks without body have 4 body. Discard when any play deck is exhausted. Cannot be duplicated.

Name: Camthalion
Text: Unique. Elf. One strike. Detainment against minion companies. +2 prowess against Elves. May also be played at Shadow-holds [S] if a Nazgul or Ringwraith is in play. May also be played against a company that has faced a non-detainment Nazgul attack this turn. As a short-event, playable on a hero character moving through a Dark-domain [d] or to a Dark-hold [D]. Target character loses all skills for the rest of the turn and must discard any Knowledge or Information events he controls.Camthalion's attack or effects are not affected by spells or magic.

Name: Twilight
Text: Environment. One environment card in play is immediately discarded. This card may also be played as a resource. This card may be played at any time during any player's turn.

Name: Wings under Trees
Text: Playable on a company moving with flying movement, to a site in Mirkwood or with only Wildernesses [w] in their site path. The prowess of each character and ally is modified by -3 (to a minimum of 6) this turn. If the company contains only Dragons, it is not considered flying this turn, but can still move up to 6 regions if winged.

Name: Wielder's Curse
Text: Dark enchantment. Playable on a weapon. After facing a strike, bearer must make a CPC, modified by -1 if a Man orDwarf and by -2 if the weapon gives a bonus or ability to a race other than bearer's race. Any normal result of a failed CP is cancelled, but defender must choose to wound either the bearer or a character in his company of the hazard player's choice. Cannot be duplicated on a given weapon.

Name: The Dark Days
Text: Discards and prevents the play of Alliance of Free Peoples and of any Elf-friend played on a Dwarf or Dwarf-friend played onan Elf. Additionally, Elf-lords must use minion versions for Dwarf- holds; Dwarf-lords must use minion versions for Elf-holds. Companies containing an Elf-lord may attack any company that contains a Dwarf and no Elf or Wizard; companies containing a Dwarf-lord may attack any company that contains an Elf and no Dwarf or Wizard. Any player may tap an Elf and a Dwarf he has in play and make a roll; if the result is greater than 8 this card is discarded. Cannot be duplicated.

Name: Western Winds
Text: Any overt minion company moving to a Free-hold [F] in Rohan, Fangorn, Wold & Foothills, or a region of Gondor or Eriador must immediately return to its site of origin.

Name: Too Narrow a Hole
Text: Playable on an or character (not a Dwarf, Hobbit, Orc or Wose). -1 to all his rolls (-2 if an Ent, Giant, Olog-hai or Dragon) while at or moving to an Under-deeps site or Dungeon. If target is a Dragon, his company's Under-deeps movement rolls are modified by -3. Cannot be duplicated on a given character.

Name: Too Narrow a Hole2
Text: Playable on an or character (not a Dwarf, Hobbit, Orc or Wose). -1 to all his rolls (-2 if an Ent, Giant, Olog-hai or Dragon) while at or moving to an Under-deeps site or Dungeon. If target is a Dragon, his company's Under-deeps movement rolls are modified by -3. Cannot be duplicated on a given character.

Name: Throkmaw at Home
Text: Unique. Unless Throkmaw Ahunt is in play, Shab Arch has an additional automatic- attack: Fire-dragon -- 2 strikes at 16/8. In addition, each Orc hazard creature played keyed to a region or site in The Northern Waste receives +1 to prowess and strikes.

Name: Throkmaw Ahunt
Text: Unique. Any company moving in Dragon Gap, Forovirkain, Grey Mountains, Talath Oiohelka, and/or Talath Uichel immediately faces a Fire-dragon attack (considered a hazard creature attack) -- 4 strikes at 13/7 (attacker chooses defending characters). If Doors of Night is in play, this attack also affects: Lhugdalf, Everdalf, Lindalf, and Withered Heath.

Name: Throkmaw
Text: Unique. Fire-dragon. May be played at Shab Arch. 3 strikes. Attacker chooses defending characters. If Doors of Night is in play, may also be played keyed to Dragon Gap, Forovirkain, Grey Mountains, Talath Oiohelka, and Talath Uichel; and at sites in these regions.

Name: Riches Gathered
Text: Playable on a Dragon-lord. At the end of his organisation phase the Dragon-lord must attack a number of characters in his company bearing an item, based on his P total. If less than 3 P: no characters; 3-5 P: 1 character; 6-8 P: 2 characters; more than 8 P: 3 characters. These attacks cannot be cancelled. Discard this card when any opponent plays an item stored at the Dragon-lord's home site.

Name: My Breath Death
Text: Only playable on a character facing a strike from Dragon's Breath. -2 to target character's prowess against the strike. If he becomes wounded but is not eliminated, he must place one item he bears in the out of play pile (defender's choice); if he is eliminated, two items must be removed instead (if available, defender's choice).

Name: Lomaw at Home
Text: Unique. Unless Lomaw Ahunt is in play, Collarmount has an additional automatic- attack: Ice-dragon -- 3 strikes at 15/8. In addition, all flattery, offering, and riddling attempts made by/for characters at or moving to a site in Wilderland or The Northern Waste are modified by -2.

Name: Lomaw Ahunt
Text: Unique. Any company moving in Barl Syrnac, Forovirkain, Lhugdalf, Talath Oiohelka, and/or Talath Uichel immediately faces an Ice-dragon attack (considered a hazard creature attack) -- 4 strikes at 12/7. If Doors of Night is in play, this attack also affects: Azjan, Forrhun, Grey Mountains, and Withered Heath.

Name: Uruial
Text: Unique. Dragon. Undead. Playable at SteelFall. 2 strikes. May also be played at any Dragon's Lair if its associated Dragon has been eliminated. If Doors of Night is in play, may also be played at any Dragon's Lair whose Dragon is in active play but not at the site. After the attack, each character wounded by Uruial makes a CP modified by -2.

Name: Lomaw
Text: Unique. Ice-dragon. May be played at Collarmount. 3 strikes. Attacker chooses defending characters if Lomaw is keyed to Collarmount. If Doors of Night is in play, may also be played keyed to Barl Syrnac, Forovirkain, Lhugdalf, Talath Oiohelka, and Talath Uichel; and at sites in these regions.

Name: Sons of Elrond
Text: Unique. Elves. Manifestation of Elladan and of Elrohir. Two strikes. Detainment against hero companies. As a creature, playable keyed to Rhudaur and its adjacent regions; and also at sites in these regions if the company contains a leader or a Ringwraith. May also be played against a company that has faced Elves upon Errantry this turn. If any strike of Sons of Elrond is successful the company must discard one item it controls (defender's choice). As a short-event, target and cancel an effect that would cancel an attack or strike from an Elf hazard creature.

Name: Sentinel of the Grove
Text: Playable on a non-Dragon's lair Ruins & Lairs [R] in a Wilderness [w]. May also be played on an oasis. The site gains an additional automatic-attack: Awakened Plant -- 1 strike with 10 prowess. Discard this card when the site leaves active play. Cannot be duplicated on a given site.

Name: Boars
Text: Animals. Boars. Two strikes. Boars receives +1 strike if Spring of Arda is in play.

Name: Bregalad
Text: Unique. Awakened Plant. Manifestation of Quickbeam.One strike. Attacker chooses defending characters. Detainment and -2 prowess against hero and covert companies. May also be played keyed to Fangorn; and at sites in that region.

Name: Choked with Vanity
Text: Playable on an Elf-lord. All his resources that can be stored and that are not stored at an Elf-hold or are not in the Elf-lord's company are never worth more than 1 mp (overriding any other card effect). Cannot be duplicated on an Elf-lord. Discard this card if his P total is less than 6.

Name: Curse Him, Root and Branch!
Text: All Awakened Plant attacks against companies of minion and Fallen-wizard players (except companies of a Gandalf, Radagast or Elf-lord player) attack normally, not as detainment. Ent allies may tap to cancel an Awakened Plant attack against their company. Invert this card when such an attack is defeated. If inverted, all Awakened Plant attacks receive +1 prowess and +1 strike; place this card in opponent's mp when one of his companies defeats an Awakened Plant attack. Otherwise, discard this card when any play deck is exhausted. Cannot be duplicated.

Name: Dark Heart
Text: Playable on a site with an Awakened Plant automatic- attack (does not count against the hazard limit). Automatic-attack(s) at the site cannot be cancelled this turn. Additionally, if this card is revealed as an on-guard card, attacker chooses defending characters for Awakened Plant automatic-attacks.

Name: Decisions of the White Council
Text: Playable if there are at least 4 manifestations of Wizards and/or Elf-lords in play (3 if none of these are characters). Discard when these conditions are not met. Up to 3 hazard long-events (cannot be environments or manifestations of a unique creature) may be placed with this card. These long-events stay in play until this card is discarded. Cannot be duplicated.

Name: Doom of the Noldor
Text: Unique. Elf creatures playable keyed to Wilderness [w] may be played at any Elf-hold. Any effect of Hair of Uinen and Ulmo's Watch played by an Elf-lord is cancelled. Additionally, if there is a ring or treasure item in play, any CP made by a Noldo for playing a spell or ritual, for transferring an item, or for playing Nenya or Vilya is modified by -1 (by -2 if there are 3 or more such items in play).

Name: Elven Archer
Text: Elf. One strike. Playable only against overt companies. May also be played keyed to any Elf-hold or region containing an Elf-hold. Attacker chooses defending characters. Against companies moving with flying movement: +4 prowess and any resulting body checks are modified by +1. Each ranger in the attacked company lowers Elven Archer's body by 1. Unless the attack is cancelled or defeated, any resource that requires a scout or ranger in target company cannot be played for the rest of the turn.

Name: Riches Gathered2
Text: Playable on a Dragon-lord. At the end of his organisation phase the Dragon-lord must attack a number of characters in his company bearing an item, based on his P: less than 3 P: no characters; 3-5 P: 1 character; 6-8 P: 2 characters; more than 8 P: 3 characters. These attacks cannot be cancelled. Discard this card when any opponent plays an item stored at the Dragon-lord's home site.

Name: Shifting Paths
Text: Environment. Playable on a moving company with more Wilderness [w] and/or Jungle [j] regions in its site path than there are avatars, rangers and/or Maia and Ent allies in the company. The defending player must replace the company's new site with a site from his location deck located in the same or an adjacent region. If none is available and both players are of the same alignment, the hazard player may take a site from his location deck instead.

Name: Elven Wards
Text: For each company moving through Hollin or Woodland Realm, or moving to an Elf-hold or any version of an Elf-lord's protected Lordhaven [H], the hazard player makes a roll, modified by +2 for an overt company and by -2 for a hero company. If the result is: 0 to 8, tap all characters in the company with mind 4 or less; 9 to 11, the company must return to its site of origin; 12+ make a body check for all characters in the company; failing this check wounds the character, or eliminates him if he was already wounded.

Name: Falathrim
Text: Elves. Five strikes. Detainment against hero companies. May be played keyed to any region that contains a hero Haven [H] and is adjacent to a Coastal Sea [c]; and also to its adjacent Coastal Sea region(s). If Gates of Morning is in play, may be played keyed to any Coastal Sea region. If The Watchful Peace is in play, may be played at any Free-hold [F] port. If all strikes are successful against an overt company, the company must return to its site of origin. As a short-event, may be played as a hero resource to cancel an attack by Pirates or Corsairs of Umbar against a hero company keyed to a Coastal Sea region or site therein.

Name: Fangorn
Text: Unique. Awakened Plant. Manifestation of Treebeard. Two strikes. Detainment and -2 prowess against hero and covert companies. As a creature, playable keyed to Fangorn, Rohan, Gap of Isen, Wold & Foothills, Enedhwaith, Old Pukel-land, Brown Lands, Anduin Vales, or Redhorn Gate, and also at Border-holds [B] and Ruins & Lairs [R] in these regions and at any site in Fangorn. As a short-event, bring one Awakened Plant hazard creature from your discard pile to your hand.

Name: Finglas
Text: Unique. Awakened Plant. Manifestation of Leaflock.One strike. Detainment and -2 prowess against hero andcovert companies. As a creature, may be played keyed to Fangorn, Rohan, Gap of Isen, Wold & Foothills, Enedhwaith, Old Pukel-land, Brown Lands, Anduin Vales, or Redhorn Gate; and also at Border-holds [B] and Ruins & Lairs [R] in these regions and at any site in Fangorn. As a short-event, play to cancel a resource event declared earlier in the same chain of effects, during the movement/hazard phase of a company that has faced an Awakened Plant attack this turn.

Name: Fladrif
Text: Unique. Awakened Plant. Manifestation of Skinbark. One strike. Detainment and -4 prowess against hero and covert companies. Playable keyed to Fangorn, Rohan, Gap of Isen, Wold & Foothills, Anduin Vales, Redhorn Gate, or Misty Mountains - Southern Spur; and also at Border-Holds [B] and Ruins & Lairs [R] in these regions and at any site in Fangorn.

Name: Goldberry, the River-daughter
Text: Unique. Manifestation of Goldberry. The hazard limit for overt companies at or moving to a site in Arthedain, Cardolan, Hollin, Old Forest, Rhudaur or The Shire is increased by one. The Oldest may be played on such a company. Additionally, every minion company moving through one of the above named regions must tap two rangers (instead of one) to cancel the effects of River or Enchanted Stream.

Name: He Is Lost to Us
Text: Playable on a Lord or Fallen-wizard if he has 6 P or more. While this card is in active play, all creatures with an asterisk (*) that are not of the same race as the avatar (Maia for Fallen-wizard) attack normally against the company, not as detainment. When this card would normally be discarded, place it in opponent's mp instead; opponent's defeated creatures with an asterisk (*) are worth full kill mp.

Name: Lord of the Woods
Text: Unique. Elf. Manifestation of Thranduil. One strike. Detainment and -3 prowess against hero companies. May be played keyed toWoodland Realm, Western Mirkwood, Heart of Mirkwood, Northern Rhovanion or Grey Mountain Narrows; and also at sites in these regions. As a permanent-event, no attack keyed to the above named regions or at sites therein is considered detainment against overt or minion companies. Additionally, any company moving in these regions faces an attack: Elves -- 2 strikes with 10 prowess (detainment against hero companies). You may return Lord of the Woods to your hand, which counts as 1 against the hazard limit.

Name: Pride
Text: Any character playing or using a card requiring a skill or race must make a CP modified by -1 (-2 if a Noldo). Cannot be duplicated.

Name: Protecting Their Domain
Text: All creature attacks keyed to Jungle [j] or Wilderness [w] receive -1 prowess. All Animal, Spider, and Awakened Plant attacks receive +1 prowess (+2 prowess if not keyed to a site). Discard this card when an Animal, Spider, or Awakened Plant attack is defeated. Cannot be duplicated.

Name: Evenstar of Her People
Text: Unique. Elf. Manifestation of Arwen. One strike. Detainment against hero companies. As a creature, may be played keyed to Rhudaur and Wold & Foothills; or at sites in these regions. As a permanent-event, each time a minion player would draw cards during his turn (except when resolving hand size), he may not draw more than two cards. For this purpose, all cards drawn for movement during multiple movement/hazard phases of a company are considered a single draw.

Name: Last Threads Loosed
Text: Playable on a character in the company of a Dragon. Make a roll and add opponent's P; if the result is lower than target character's mind, discard this card. Otherwise, discard any Dragon Mindbend, Enchanted Stare, or Oath to the Dragon from the character. Unless target character is controlled by a Dragon, any influence check against him by a Dragon automatically fails. Cannot be duplicated in a given turn.

Name: Kine of Araw
Text: Animals. Each character in the company faces a strike. May be played keyed to Dorwinion, Forrhun, Harrhun, Horse Plains, and Southern Rhovanion; and also at Ruins & Lairs [R] in these regions. +2 prowess if the company has already faced Kine of Araw this turn. A character with a home site in one of these regions may tap to cancel an attack by Kine of Araw against his company.

Name: Khuzadrepa at Home
Text: Unique. Unless Khuzadrepa Ahunt is in play, Thunder Cleft has an additional automatic- attack: Cold-dragon -- 2 strikes at 16/9. In addition, each Dwarf wounded by a strike from a Balrog, Dragon, or Spawn attack must make a CP modified by -1 (after any body checks).

Name: Angurth Ahunt
Text: Unique. Any company moving in Dragon Gap, Forovirkain, Grey Mountains, Grey Mountain Narrows, and/or Withered Heath immediately faces a Fire-dragon attack (considered a hazard creature attack) -- 3 strikes at 14/7 (attacker chooses defending characters, but strikes must first be assigned to any Dwarves in the defending company). If Doors of Night is in play, this attack also affects: Iron Hills, Northern Rhovanion, and Talath Oiohelka.

Name: Angurth
Text: Unique. Fire-dragon. May be played at Long Peak. 2 strikes. Attacker chooses defending characters, but strikes must first be assigned to any Dwarves in the defending company. If Doors of Night is in play, may also be played keyed to Dragon Gap, Forovirkain, Grey Mountains, Grey Mountain Narrows, and Withered Heath; and at sites in these regions.

Name: Ando-anca at Home
Text: Unique. Unless Ando-anca Ahunt is in play, Norr-dum has an additional automatic-attack: Cold-dragon -- 3 strikes at 17/8. In addition, all body checks for Dunedain, Dwarves, Elves, Hobbits, Men, Orcs, Trolls, and Umli resulting from unique Dragon attacks are modified by +1.

Name: Ando-anca Ahunt
Text: Unique. Any company moving in Dragon Gap, Forovirkain, Grey Mountains, Grey Mountain Narrows, and/or Withered Heath immediately faces a Cold-dragon attack (considered a hazard creature attack) -- 4 strikes at 14/7. If Doors of Night is in play, this attack also affects: Anduin Vales, Northern Rhovanion, and Talath Uichel.

Name: Ando-anca
Text: Unique. Cold-dragon. May be played at Norr-dum. 3 strikes. If Doors of Night is in play, may also be played keyed to Dragon Gap, Forovirkain, Grey Mountains, Grey Mountain Narrows, and Withered Heath; and at sites in these regions.

Name: Wings under Trees2
Text: Playable on a company moving with flying movement, to a site in Mirkwood or with only Wilderness [w] in its site path. The prowess of each character and ally is modified by -3 (to a minimum of 6) this turn. If the company consists only of Dragon characters it is not considered flying this turn, but can still move up to 6 regions if winged.

Name: Bardings
Strikes: men. each character in the company faces a strike (detainment against covert and hero companies). may be played keyed to dorwinion, grey mountain narrows, iron hills, northern rhovanion, or southern rhovanion; and may also be played at non-haven sites in these regions. may also be played on dale or lake- town, creating an additional automatic-attack (discard bardings at the end of the site phase). may not be played against a covert or hero company containing a character with a home site in dorwinion, northern rhovanion, or southern rhovanion.
Text: Men. Each character in the company faces a strike (detainment against covert and hero companies). May be played keyed to Dorwinion, Grey Mountain Narrows, Iron Hills, Northern Rhovanion, or Southern Rhovanion; and may also be played at non-Haven sites in these regions. May also be played on Dale or Lake- town, creating an additional automatic-attack (discard Bardings at the end of the site phase). May not be played against a covert or hero company containing a character with a home site in Dorwinion, Northern Rhovanion, or Southern Rhovanion.

Name: Birth-spot
Text: Playable on a Dragon character. He receives -3 body. When the Dragon-character does not tap to face a strike of an attack, he receives an additional -3 prowess penalty. If at his home site (or any Dragon's Den [K]) during his organization phase, target Dragon may tap to discard this card. Cannot be duplicated.

Name: Cursed Treasure
Text: Corruption. Playable on-guard at a Dragon's Lair, if the corresponding Dragon is in active play but not at the site. Reveal and place this card on a character after playing a treasure item or an item stored at (any version of) the site; the character receives 4 corruption points and must immediately make a CP.

Name: Angurth at Home
Text: Unique. Unless Angurth Ahunt is in play, Long Peak has an additional automatic-attack: Fire-dragon -- 2 strikes at 17/8. In addition, each company at a non-Haven site in Wilderland that did not attempt to move this turn has its hazard limit increased by 1.

Name: Dragon Hunters
Text: Dwarves. 4 strikes. +4 prowess and -1 to target's body against companies containing a Dragon or Drake. May only be played against an overt company. Dragon Hunters receives an additional +1 prowess for every Gathered Bones of Dwarf characters or Dwarf factions in opponent's mp. May be played keyed to any region containing a Dragon's lair or Dwarf-hold, and keyed on any non-Haven site in those regions.

Name: Great Northern Bear
Text: Animal. Bear. 1 strike. +4 prowess against Dragons. May be played keyed to Anduin Vales, Dragon Gap, Grey Mountains, Grey Mountain Narrows, Gundabad, Heart of Mirkwood, High Pass, Northern Rhovanion, Western Mirkwood, Withered Heath, and Woodland Realm; and may also be played non-Haven sites in these regions. May not be played against a company containing a character with Beorn's House as a home site. Cannot be duplicated on a given movement/hazard phase.

Name: Greater Storms
Text: Environment. Playable on a company using flying movement. Make a roll. If the result is less than 7, tap all characters and allies in the company. Otherwise, the company is not considered flying for the rest of the turn (change the site path accordingly; if the company cannot reach the new site, defender must choose a new within 2 regions of the original site of destination).

Name: Kelvar Enraged
Text: All attacks by Apes, Bears, Boars, Eagles andWhales receive +1 strike and -2 body. Each character wounded by such an attack must make an additional body check. Discard this card if such an attack is defeated.

Name: Khuzadrepa
Text: Unique. Cold-dragon. May be played at Thunder Cleft. 2 strikes. Attacker chooses defending characters. If Doors of Night is in play, may also be played keyed to Forrhun, Grey Mountains, Iron Hills, Northern Rhovanion, and Withered Heath; may also be played at sites in these regions. +2 prowess against Dwarves.

Name: Khuzadrepa Ahunt
Text: Unique. Any company moving in Forrhun, Grey Mountains, Iron Hills, Northern Rhovanion and/or Withered Heath immediately faces a Cold-dragon attack (considered a hazard creature attack) -- 3 strikes at 13/8 (attacker chooses defending characters); +2 prowess against Dwarves. If Doors of Night is in play, this attack also affects: Dorwinion, Eorstan and Grey Mountain Narrows.

Name: Khuzadrepa at Home2
Text: Unique. Unless Khuzadrepa Ahunt is in play, Thunder Cleft has an additional automatic- attack: Cold-dragon -- 2 strikes at 16/9. In addition, each Dwarf wounded by a strike from a Balrog, Dragon or Spawn (attack) must make a CP modified by -1 (after the body check).

Name: Kine of Araw2
Text: Animals. Each character in the company faces a strike. May be played keyed to Dorwinion, Forrhun, Harrhun, Horse Plains and Southern Rhovanion; and also at Ruins & Lairs [R] in these regions. +2 prowess if the company has already faced Kine of Araw this turn. A character with a home site in any of the above regions may tap to cancel an attack by Kine of Araw against his company.

Name: Last Threads Loosed2
Text: Playable on a character in the company of a Dragon. Make a roll and add opponent's P; if the result is lower than target character's mind, discard this card. Otherwise, discard any Dragon Mindbend, Enchanted Stare, or Oath to the Dragon from the character. Unless target character is controlled by a Dragon, any influence check against him by a Dragon automatically fails. Cannot be duplicated by a given player.

Name: Men of the Wood2
Strikes: men. each character in the company faces a strike (detainment against covert and hero companies). may be played keyed to anduin vales, heart of mirkwood and western mirkwood; and may also be played keyed to non-haven sites in these regions. may also be played on woodmen-town or mathlaburg, creating an additional automatic-attack (discard men of the wood at the end of the site phase). may not be played against a covert or hero company containing a character with woodmen-town as a home site.
Text: Men. Each character in the company faces a strike (detainment against covert and hero companies). May be played keyed to Anduin Vales, Heart of Mirkwood and Western Mirkwood; and may also be played keyed to non-Haven sites in these regions. May also be played on Woodmen-town or Mathlaburg, creating an additional automatic-attack (discard Men of the Wood at the end of the site phase). May not be played against a covert or hero company containing a character with Woodmen-town as a home site.

Name: Dragon's Sleep
Text: Playable on a Dragon character moving awayfrom his home site or any Dragon's Den [K]. Unless opponent discards Hunger or a manifestation of target Dragon from his hand, the Dragon must return to his site of origin (also discard Wide Awake if played on the Dragon).

Name: At Their Throats
Text: Playable on a Dragon faction. Choose another Dragon faction in active play that shares at least 1 region for its attack with target faction. Make a roll adding the number regions that both factions share for their attack, plus any influence modification against each other (ignoring the negative); if the result is greater than opponent's free GI, the two factions attack eachother. Each faction's prowess and body are equal to the attack on their card and the controlling player makes the roll. No resources may be played. If a Dragon faction is thus eliminated remove this card from the game. Otherwise the loosing faction is wounded (invert it); it is worth half its normal mp (round down) and can be healed by making a successful influence attempt against the faction. Cannot be duplicated on a given turn.

Name: Attrition
Text: Any defeated non-unique Gathered Bones inany players mp does not give any mp (overriding any resource effect). Additionally, all Dragon-lords and War- lords receive +2 P. Any defeated creature or Gathered Bones does not give any mp for a Lord, Dragon-lord, or War-lord with less than 6 P.

Name: Attrition2
Text: Fallen-wizard and minion players cannot receive more mp from killed creatures and trophies than they have P (half their P total for Fallen-wizards). Additionally, Dragon-lords do not receive any mp for their non-unique Gathered Bones.

Name: Khuzadrepa Ahunt2
Text: Unique. Any company moving in Forrhun, Grey Mountains, Iron Hills, Northern Rhovanion, and/or Withered Heath immediately faces a Cold-dragon attack (considered a hazard creature attack) -- 3 strikes at 13/8 (attacker chooses defending characters); +2 prowess against Dwarves. If Doors of Night is in play, this attack also affects: Dorwinion, Eorstan, and Grey Mountain Narrows.

Name: Khuzadrepa2
