Playable at The White Towers if Councellors of the North Kingdom is in play and the influence check is greater than 8.Standard Modifications: Hobbits (+2), Dunedain (+2).Red Book of Westmarch may be stored at The White Towers. If stored there, it gives 3 mp and all versions of The White Towers become a Free-hold [F]. The hero version loses all automatic-attacks; replace automatic- attacks for the minion version with: Hobbits -- 3 strikes with 6 prowess, Dunedain -- 2 strikes with 10 prowess.

Name: Choice of Luthien
Text: Unique. Playable on Arwen in Minas Tirith. She receives +2 direct influence and her mind increases by 2. Discard if Arwen moves to a site not in Anorien, Lebennin, Lamedon, Belfalas, or Anfalas. Tap Arwen to take one item, ally, or faction playable at her current site from your play deck or discard pile into your hand (reshuffle play deck if searched).

Name: The Gwaedhel-sword
Text: Unique. Playable at Vamag. Weapon. +2 prowess(+4 against Undead).Values in parentheses apply when The Gwaedhel-spear is in the company. You may play Banishment on this item (as if it were a Ruins & Lairs [R]); only then can it be used as a hero resource. Minion only: tap: play Endless Whispers on a character the bearer has defeated in CvCC this turn. Hero only: tap: discard a dark enchantment played on the company or an associated entity.

Name: The King's Men
Text: Playable at any Dunadan-hold port (not in Gondor),if Black Numenoreans is not in play and you discard from hand or play The White Council or The Black Council, and if the influence check is greater than 8.Standard Modifications: Dunedain (+2), each The King's Men you have in play (+2). This faction is considered a manifestation of Black Numenoreans for the purpose of making influence attempts. Cannot be duplicated at a given site.

Name: Hobbit-lore
Text: Lore. Playable on Gandalf during the organization phase while at a Haven. If untapped, tap Gandalf afterwards. He receives +2 direct influence against Hobbits and Hobbit factions. {cyan} UEP: Playable on Gandalf during the organization phase. If untapped, tap Gandalf afterwards. He receives +2 direct influence against Hobbits and Hobbit factions.

Name: Hidden Knife
Text: Playable on any face-up agent during your site phase. You may play a hazard creature from your hand keyed to a face-up agent's current site which immediately attacks the agent as if the agent were a character. You do not receive marshalling points if the agent is eliminated.

Name: Here Is a Snake!
Text: Playable on a company during its movement/hazard phase after cards have been drawn. Opponent may reveal to you any number of hazards from his hand. He may only play hazards he revealed to you (including on-guard cards) for the remainder of target company's movement/hazard phase. Alternatively, a face-down agent is tapped and revealed.

Name: Herb-lore
Text: Lore. Playable on Radagast while moving during his movement/hazard phase if there is at least one Wilderness in his site path. If untapped, tap Radagast afterwards. During any organization phase, Radagast can tap and discard this card to heal all characters in his company from wounded to untapped and to untap all tapped characters.

Name: Healing of Nimrodel
Text: Playable during the organization phase on a moving company whose site of origin is a Haven. If the company moves to another Haven this turn, at the end of the movement/hazard phase all wounded characters in the company heal (from wounded to untapped) and all tapped characters untap.

Name: Hall of Fire
Text: Playable on a Haven. Any company at this Haven immediately following its movement/hazard phase may choose for one of its characters to untap or heal (from wounded to tapped). Discard Hall of Fire when the site card is returned to the location deck.

Name: Gems of Arda
Text: Ore. Playable at The Gem-deeps. If you have a stored Vein of Arda, playable at any Under-deeps site. During any organization phase in which you store Gems of Arda, you may immediately tap a character in the same company and play with him a non-special item from your hand or discard pile. This item must be identical to an item that your opponent has already stored. Your opponent's stored item is discarded, and you may never store the item you played.

Name: Free to Choose
Text: Playable on an item that normally gives 3 corruption points or more. Target item gives 2 fewer corruption points (3 fewer if Gates of Morning is in play). Discard after its bearer makes a corruption check. Cannot be duplicated on a given item.

Name: Forgotten Scrolls
Text: Lost Knowledge. Can also be played at Minas Tirith if the site is tapped. Cannot be included with a starting company. After this item is played, the bearer faces an attack (cannot be cancelled): Trap - 1 strike with 8 prowess (weapons do not modify prowess against this strike). If its bearer is at a Ruins & Lairs, discard Forgotten Scrolls to make information playable at the site until the end of the turn.

Name: Forewarned Is Forearmed
Text: Any non-Dragon Lair site with more than one automatic-attack is reduced to having one automatic-attack of the hazard player's choice. Any creature or other hazard with more than one attack is reduced to one attack of the hazard player's choice. Discard when such an isolated attack is defeated. Cannot be duplicated.

Name: First of the Order
Text: Playable on Saruman. Saruman receives +2 to all corruption checks for the rest of the turn.

Name: Fireworks
Text: Ritual. Playable on an untapped sage at a tapped Border-holdor Free-hold. Tap sage. Make a roll (draw a #) and add the mind of the sage (+10 if a Wizard)-if the result is greater than 12, the site untaps. The next time the sage would otherwise become untapped, make him tapped instead and discard this card.

Name: Fifteen Birds in Five Firtrees
Text: Playable on a moving company facing a non-unique hazard creature if Gates of Morning is in play. All attacks of the creature are cancelled and all attacks of the next non-unique hazard creature the company faces this turn are also cancelled. An untapped character in the company must tap to face any strike from a subsequent hazard creature attack for the rest of the turn. The company must do nothing during its site phase unless it contains a Wizard or you discard Eagle-mounts from your hand. Cannot be duplicated on a given turn.

Name: Fate of the Ithil-stone
Text: Playable on a company at Minas Tirith if the company discards (for no effect) a Lost Knowledge card it controls. Tap this card if the company plays a Palantir; this card never untaps. If this card is tapped, invert it on the playing surface (rotate it 180 degrees) if the company enters Barad-dur and plays a Stolen Knowledge card during the same site phase. If this card is inverted, it can be stored at a Haven-only if stored do you receive its marshalling points. If this card is stored, all Palantiri give one less corruption point. Once inverted, no other copy of this card can be inverted.

Name: Face out of Sight
Text: All on-guard cards are returned to owner's hands. At the end of any turn, all wounded and tapped agents are returned to their owner's hands. Cannot be duplicated.

Name: Eyes of Mandos
Text: Playable on Pallando during the organization phase. Tap Pallando and reveal up to 8 cards from the top of your play deck. Choose one to put into your hand and shuffle the remaining ones into your play deck.

Name: Enduring Tales
Text: When any player discards a card from his hand, he may discard it to the top of his play deck (and always face down) instead of to his discard pile.

Name: Dwarven Light-stone
Text: Treasure. Playable at any Under-deep site. +2 to all rolls required for bearer's company to move to an adjacent site in the Under-deeps. Tap Dwarven Light-stone: to modify by -2 the prowess of one attack for which "weapons do not modify the target's prowess" (e.g., Trap, Lava Flow, etc.), or to modify by -2 the prowess of one Orc or Troll attack.

Name: Dragon-helm
Text: Unique. Playable at any Under-deep Dark-hold (D) or Shadow-hold (S). Helmet. Warrior only: +1 prowess; +2 body (to a maximum of 10); +3 direct influence. Tap Dragon-helm to cancel one attack by Dragons or Drakes.

Name: Dark Numbers
Text: Stolen Knowledge. Playable on an untapped scout immediately after facing an Orc, Troll, or Man attack. Tap scout. Can be stored at a Haven. If not stored, discard to give +3 to an influence attempt against a faction by a character in the same company.

Name: Cup of Farewell
Text: Playable on a company at a Haven [h] during the organization phase. Once during each of your turns, you can tap a character in this company, if the company is at a Haven, to take a minor item from your sideboard into your hand (show opponent). Cannot be duplicated on a given company.

Name: Horns, Horns, Horns
Text: Each player removes all factions from his discard pile and shuffles them into his play deck.

Name: Hour of Need
Text: Playable on an untapped non-warrior, non-Wizard diplomat during the organization phase if you have a faction in your hand. Play a faction from your hand. Tap diplomat who then makes an influence attempt on this faction. Count out the number of contiguous regions from the diplomat's site to the site where the faction is normally playable (including the regions containing both sites)-subtract two plus this number from the diplomat's attempt. If the attempt is unsuccessful, discard the diplomat and faction.  May not be played by a Dwarf-lord or Elf-lord player.

Name: Hundreds of Butterflies
Text: Playable on a moving character during his movement/hazard phase. Untap the character and increase the hazard limit against his company by one.

Name: I Know Much about You
Text: Cancels any agent attack or any hazard effect that requires tapping an agent declared earlier in the same chain of effects or one attack from a hazard creature with multiple attacks (e.g., Slayer, Nameless Thing).

Name: Into Dark Tunnels
Text: Playable at the end of the movement/hazard phase on a company that has moved to an Under-deep site. That company may attempt to move to an additional site on the same turn. Another site card may be played and a movement/hazard phase immediately follows.

Name: The Mayor
Text: Unique. Playable on Sam Gamgee at Bag End or Michel Delving if he controls To Fealty Sworn. Discard if Will Whitfoot is in play. Sam may tap to cancel the effects of a hazard event played on a Hobbit in his company before it resolves, or to take Wit or The Riddle Game from your discard pile to your hand.

Name: The Ring Goes to Gondor
Text: Unique. Playable on The One Ring, if it is at a site in Gondor and borne by Aragorn II, Boromir II, Denethor II, or Faramir, and if you have Steward of Gondor in play. Discard if these conditions are not met. Bearer receives +1 to his CP. All Dunadan and Man creatures with an asterisk (*) and keyed to a region or site in Gondor against a minion company receive +1 prowess and strikes. Each site in Gondor at which a Dunadan or Man hero faction is in play becomes a Free-hold [F]; the region containing such a site becomes a Free-domain [f]. Rotate this card 90deg (or place a token) during your end-of-turn phase: it is worth 2 mp for each time rotated (to a maximum of 8p). p).

Name: The Ring Goes to Gondor2
Text: Unique. Playable on The One Ring, if at a site in Gondor and borne by Aragorn II, Boromir II, Denethor II, or Faramir, and if you have Steward of Gondor in play. Discard if these conditions are not met. Bearer receives +1 to his CP. Dunadan and Man creatures with an asterisk (*) and keyable to a region in Gondor may be played keyed to any region or site in Gondor and receive +1 prowess and strikes. Rotate this card 90deg (or place a token) during your end-of-turn phase: it gives 2 mp for each time rotated (to a maximum of 8p). p).

Name: The Seaward Tower
Text: Unique. Playable on Dol Amroth if you discard (for no effect) a Lost Knowledge card from the company. While you have a company at Dol Amroth, for any of your companies at or moving to a site in Anfalas, Belfalas, or Bay of Belfalas, opponent must reveal at the beginning of their movement/hazard phase any creature cards playable against that company. Only creatures thus revealed may be played against such a company, and you may tap a faction you have in play at sites in these regions to cancel such a creature attack. Discard this card if Dol Amroth leaves active play.

Name: The Seaward Tower2
Text: Playable on Dol Amroth. For any of your companies moving to a site in Belfalas or its adjacent regions you may discard one Alert the Folk from hand to give an attack the company faces -1 to prowess and strikes (to a minimum of two) for each unique faction you have in play at sites in these regions. Discard if Dol Amroth leaves active play. Cannot be duplicated by a given player.

Name: The Seaward Tower3
Text: Unique. Playable on Dol Amroth if you discard (for no effect) a Lost Knowledge card from the company. Place one Alert the Folk with this card `off the side'. For any of your companies at or moving to a site in Anfalas, Belfalas, Bay of Belfalas, Lebennin or Mouths of the Anduin you may use this Alert the Folk replacing the Drake o Dragon attack with an attack from Corsairs of Umbar, Pirates or for any faction battle in the above regions. The factions allowed for use with this Alert the Folk MUST be playable in Gondor, rather than the ones listed on Alert the Folk. Discard Alert the Folk after use. Discard this card if Dol Amroth leaves active play.

Name: The Thain
Text: Unique. Playable on Pippin at Sackville or Tuckburrow if he controls To Featly Sworn. He may tap to cancel Pilfer Anything Unwatched before it resolves. Alternatively, tap Pippin (at any time) to take The Shirriffs from your discard pile to your hand.

Name: The Wind Is Turning
Text: Environment. Playable on a non-overt company. Discard one environment hazard long-event in play. Alternatively, make a roll: if the result is greater than 6, discard any one hazard permanent-event not played on a company (or an associated entity). Cannot be duplicated during a given turn.

Name: This We Will Take
Text: Playable on a character during CvCC, before strikes are assigned. Tap the character and reveal from hand a non-ring item borne by a character in opponent's company. You and opponent each make a roll for their characters, modified by +2 if he is an avatar, diplomat, or spirit-magic user, and by adding the number of characters in his company. If your result exceeds that of your opponent, you may immidiately play the item with target character; opponent must discard his version. Afterwards, CvCC proceeds normally.

Name: The Hour Is Come
Text: For each Palantir a player has in active play, one of his cards in hand must remain revealed at all times. Such a revealed card cannot be played as on-guard card and may only be discarded from hand by hazard effect. When it is played, it is immediately replaced by the top card from the play deck. Discard when any play deck is exhausted.

Name: This We Will Take2
Text: Playable on a character during CvCC, if you have an item in hand (not a ring) which a character in opponent's company bears. Each character makes a roll (+2 if character is an avatar) and adds the number of characters in his company. If your result exceeds your opponent's, you may immidiately play the item; opponent must discard his version.

Name: Town Guard
Text: Playable on a hero or covert company at or moving to a Free-hold [F] or Border-hold [B], if a non-animal, non-Ent faction of your alignment is in play at the site. Play to cancel an attack keyed to the site or to give the attack -3 prowess (your choice). May also be played during opponent's site phase to cancel CvCC.

Name: War Preparations
Text: Stolen Knowledge. Scout only. Playable during the site phase on an untapped scout at a tapped or untapped Shadow-hold [S] or Dark-hold [D] in Mordor. Tap the scout. May be stored at a Haven [H] for 2 mp. You may discard a stored War Preparations to take a faction playable at a site in Gondor from your discard pile or sideboard to your hand. Cannot be duplicated at a given site.

Name: Window of the Sunset
Text: Playable on Henneth Annun or a Wose-hold. All versions of the site become a hidden site. Opponent's company must either tap two scouts or two wolf allies in the company, or discard a Stolen Knowledge card it contains, to reveal any version of this site as a new site. Agents may only move to any version of this site if they have the site as a home site. Discard this card if you have no faction or company present at the site.

Name: Wizard's Pupil
Text: Unique. Playable on Faramir, if Gandalf is in the company or you discard (for no effect) a Lost Knowledge card he controls. Faramir gains the sage skill. +1 to his mind and +2 EI against non-warrior characters. +2 to his CP when bearing a ring or Lost Knowledge item.

Name: Wose Blowpipe
Text: Wose only. tap: consider a successful strike from a non-detainment, non-Nazgul, non-Undead attack against a character in the company defeated (all effects of the successful strike still apply). Make a roll to determine if the strike's body is also defeated; a strike with no body is considered to have 4 body.

Name: Wose Burial Site
Text: Playable at the end of the organization phase on a company that contains a Wose and uses region cards, with the last one being a region containing a Wose-hold (or an adjacent non-Coastal Sea region). This card is used as a site card: Ruins & Lairs [R] Automatic-attack: Pukel-creature -- 1 strike with 7 prowess. Playable: Items (minor), card draw: 1/1. A ranger at this site may tap to play Healing Herbs from your hand, discard pile, or side- board (even if the site is tapped). The hazard limit for a company moving to this site is reduced by 2 (to a minimum of 2), and no creatures may be keyed to this site, except Pukel-creature or Undead. The company may only leave the site using region movement. Discard Wose Burial Site when the company moves to a new site.

Name: Wose Hunter Tattoo
Text: Playable on a company containing a Wose majority, if you have a Wose faction in play. While the company moves to or from a Wose-hold, Wose characters in the company count as half characters for the purpose of calculating the hazard limit. Additionally, all Woses in the company receive +2 prowess against Orcs and Wolves. If an Orc or Wolf attack against the company is cancelled, all Woses in the company must make a CP. Cannot be duplicated on a given company

Name: Wose Shamanist Amulet
Text: Rune item. Playable only with a company containing a Wose, or after the successful play of a Wose faction or rune item. You may place one non-asterisk (*) Animal, Spider, or Wolf creature the company has defeated with this item. tap: cancel an attack of a type corresponding with the attached creature.

Name: Wose Shamanist Potion
Text: Playable only with a company containing a Wose, or after the successful play of a Wose faction or rune item. Discard this item to automatically defeat all strikes against the bearer from attacks keyed to Wilderness [w] or Ruins & Lairs [R] this turn. Bearer makes a body check modified by -1 (wound him if he fails, eliminate if already wounded).

Name: You've Come Back Changed
Text: Playable on a Hobbit at Bree. Tap target Hobbit during the site phase at a Shadow-hold [S] or Dark-hold [D] to tap this card; this card never untaps. If this card is tapped, during the site phase at Bree the Hobbit may tap to invert this card. If this card is inverted, it gives 2 mp and target Hobbit receives +1 prowess (+3 against Men and agents). Cannot be duplicated on a given Hobbit.

Name: Tower of Ecthelion
Text: Unique. Playable on Minas Tirith if you have Return of the King or Steward of Gondor in play. This card gives 2 mp if you have Tower Guard of Minas Tirith and The White Tree in play. Discard if Minas Tirith leaves active play or if Smoke on the Wind is played at the site. tap: if a character at the site has used Palantir of Minas Tirith this turn, to untap Minas Tirith. This card does not untap normally. Instead, tap a character at the site with a mind of five or more to untap it.

Name: The Prancing Pony
Text: Unique. Playable on Bree. Tap a non-overt character during the site phase at Bree to make Information or News from the Shire playable there this turn. Any player may tap an agent they have in play at Bree to make Nazgul creatures playable at the site (not counting against the hazard limit if a ringbearer is at the site). Afterwards, discard this card. Discard this card if Bree leaves active play.

Name: Of the Race of Dale2
Text: Playable on Bard Bowman, Bain, or Brand. When target character controls a Black Arrow and is assigned a strike from a Dragon or Drake attack, tap Black Arrow to give a -3 modification to the attack's prowess and body (instead of its normal modification). Discard if there is more than one Black Arrow in the company. Cannot be duplicated on a given character.

Name: The Bullroarer's Club
Text: Unique. Weapon. Playable at Michel Delving. May also be played at any site in The Shire by The Thain or a character with Mathom Lore. +1 prowess. Hobbit warrior only: +2 prowess and +2 EI against Hobbits.

Name: Alliance among Neighbours
Text: Playable on a region containing an opponent's Dragon's Den [K]. All hero factions in play at sites in target region (or regions adjacent) give +1 mp. Discard this card if no such faction is in play or if a Dragon-lord in Dream Mode is in play.Cannot be duplicated.

Name: Alliance among Neighbours2
Text: Playable at a site within the same or an adjacent region as an opponent's Dragon's Den [K], if you have a faction in play at the site or in your in lieu of minor item if you start the game at as a site. Your influence attempts against hero factions only playable at sites in these regions are modified by +2. All of these factions receive + 2 prowess in faction battles or in any type of combat versus Dragon manifestations. If such a faction is used with Alert the Folk, it is reshuffled to your deck (or placed in sideboard) instead of discarded. Discard this card if no such faction is in play, or if opponent has Dragon's Dream in play. Cannot be duplicated.

Name: Sprautabern
Text: Unique. Grey agent. +1 prowess against Orcsand Wolves. Is considered Beorn for the purpose of playing Skin-changer. Agent only: may move two regions per agent action if moving to a site in The Northern Waste. tap: during movement/hazard phase to attack a company moving to his current Ruins & Lairs [R] or Shadow-hold [S] or to his home site.

Name: Alliance among Neighbours3
Text: Playable on a region containing an opponent's Dragon's Den [K]. All hero factions in play at sites in target region (or regions adjacent) give +1 mp. Discard this card if no such faction is in play or if a Dragon-lord in Dream Mode is in play.Cannot be duplicated.

Name: Refuge
Text: Playable only if you discard an Elf from your hand and only at the end of the organization phase on a company using region cards with the last one being a Wilderness [{w}]. (Play regions face-up.) This card is used as a site card, Free-hold [{F}] (cards drawn: 1/1). The company may only leave this site using region movement. Characters at this site heal as though they were in a haven [{H}]. Discard Refuge when the company moves to a new site.

Name: Pledge of Conduct
Text: Diplomat only. A character facing a corruption check in the diplomat's company may automatically transfer one item he bears to another character in his company. The item must be transferrable, and the new bearer must be able to bear it.

Name: Axe-master
Text: Warrior only. Playable on a Dwarf, Man, Orc, or Sinda Elf. If target character bears an axe and is chosen to face a strike from an attack with less strikes than the prowess bonus the axe gives against that attack, you may tap the axe and the character to face any number of strikes from the attack (in separate strike sequences). Each body check bearer makes is modified by an additional +1. Bearer makes a CP. This card gives 2 corruption points to an overt or minion character.

Name: New Friendship
Text: Diplomat only. +3 to any one influence check or +2 to a corruption check made by a character in the same company.

Name: Old Friendship
Text: Diplomat only. +5 to an influence check against a character or +4 to a corruption check made by a character in the same company.

Name: Old Road
Text: Allows a character at a Haven [{H}] to attempt to bring a faction into play. The length of the site path from this Haven to the site at which the faction can be played must be two or less (this must be verified by an available site card). The influence check for this attempt is modified by -1 and is not modified by the influencing character's direct influence.

Name: Orcrist
Text: Unique. Weapon. +3 to prowess to a maximum of 9 (+4 prowess to a maximum of 10 against Orcs).

Name: Palantir of Amon Sul
Text: Unique. Palantir. If the bearer's company is ever below 2 characters and the company moves, discard the Palantir. 5 marshalling points if stored in a Haven [{H}]. With its bearer able to use a Palantir, tap Palantir of Amon Sul to look at your opponent's hand or tap it to use the abilities of either the Palantir of Annuminas or the Palantir of Elostirion if either one is in play. Bearer makes a corruption check.

Name: Palantir of Annuminas
Text: Unique. Palantir. With its bearer able to use a Palantir, tap Palantir of Annuminas to search through your play deck and discard pile for a sage only card. Put this card in your hand. Reshuffle your play deck. Bearer makes a corruption check.

Name: Palantir of Elostirion
Text: Unique. Palantir. Playable only at The White Towers. Discard if the bearer moves. If the bearer is a sage, he may tap Palantir of Elostirion to remove one corruption card from an Elf or a Wizard under your control. Bearer makes a corruption check.

Name: Palantir of Minas Tirith
Text: Unique. Palantir. Playable only at Minas Tirith. With its bearer able to use a Palantir, tap Palantir of Minas Tirith to look at the top five cards of your play deck; shuffle these 5 cards and return them to the top of your play deck. do the same to your opponent's play deck. Bearer makes a corruption check.

Name: Palantir of Orthanc
Text: Unique. Palantir. Playable only at Isengard. With its bearer able to use a Palantir and with at least 5 cards in your play deck, tap Palantir of Orthanc to choose one card from your discard pile to place in your play deck (reshuffle the play deck). Bearer makes a corruption check.

Name: Palantir of Osgiliath
Text: Unique. Palantir. If the bearer's company is ever below 4 character and the company moves, discard. 5 marshalling pts. if stored in a Haven [{H}]. With its bearer able to use a Palantir, tap Palantir of Osgiliath to force the discard of any hazard permanent-event or to duplicate the effect of any Palantir in play. Bearer makes a corruption check.

Name: Paths of the Dead
Text: Playable only at the end of the organization phase. For its movement, a company that starts at the Dunharrow site and contains Aragorn II may move to the Vale of Erech site. The only hazard creatures that may be played on this company are Undead, but any Undead may be played on the company.

Name: Persuasive Words
Text: Diplomat only. Make two rolls (or draw two #'s) when making an influence check and choose one result to use.

Name: Potion of Prowess
Text: Food. Discard to give +1 prowess to all characters in bearer's company until the end of the turn.

Name: Praise to Elbereth
Text: Song. For each of your characters in play that you choose to tap, cancel one Nazgul event or one Nazgul attack. Additionally, if Doors of Night is in play, characters gain +1 prowess until the end of the turn.

Name: Precious Gold Ring
Text: Discard Precious Gold Ring when tested. If tested, make a roll (or draw a #) to determine which ring card may be immediately played: - The One Ring (10, 11, 12+); - a Dwarven ring (8, 9, 10, 11, 12+); - a Magic Ring (1, 2, 3, 4, 5); - a Lesser Ring (any result).

Name: Quickbeam
Text: Unique. Ent. Playable at Wellinghall. May not be attacked by automatic-attacks or hazards keyed to his site.

Name: Quiet Lands
Text: Environment. Until the end of the turn, the number of strikes for one automatic-attack at a Shadow-hold [{S}] or Ruins & Lairs [{R}] is reduced by half (round up). Alternatively, if Gates of Morning is in play, treat one Shadow-land [{s}] as a Wilderness [{w}], or one Shadow-hold [{S}] as a Ruins & Lairs [{R}] until the end of the turn. Cannot be duplicated.

Name: Rangers of Ithilien
Text: Unique. Playable at Henneth Annun if the influence check is greater than 7. Standard Modifications: Dunedain (+1).

Name: Rangers of the North
Text: Unique. Playable at Bree if the influence check is greater than 9. Standard Modifications: Dunedain (+1).

Name: Red Arrow
Text: Unique. Bearer may automatically influence the Riders of Rohan. +5 to the bearer's direct influence against any character with Edoras as a home site.

Name: Returned Exiles
Text: Unique. Playable at a tapped or untapped site where an at home Dragon manifestation was defeated if the influence check is greater than 12. Standard Modifications: King under the Mountain Dwarf (+5), other Dwarves (+2).

Name: Red Book of Westmarch
Text: Unique. Lost Knowledge. Only playable at Bag End. +2 to direct influence against a Hobbit character or faction. 1 marshalling point if stored at a Haven [{H}].

Name: Alliance among Neighbours4
Text: Playable if a Dragon-lord is in play. Allunique hero factions playable at sites in a region that contains a Dragon's Den [K] (and regions adjacent to these if the Dragon- lord is not in a dream mode) are worth 1 extra miscellaneous mp. Discard this card if no such faction is in play. Cannot be duplicated.

Name: Rhun
Text: Playable during organization phase on a company moving without region cards. Company may move from a site of orgin if one of the following regions to a new site in one of the following regions: Iron Hills, Dorwinion, Horse Plains, and Khand. The site path is [www] and the hazard limit is decreased by two to a minimum of two.

Name: When I Know Anything
Text: Light Enchantment. Playable on a sage during the site phase at a site where "Information" is playable. Tap sage and site. Tap sage to modify one corruption check by a character in his company by +3. Sage makes a corruption check.

Name: Waybread
Text: Food. Only playable at Lorien. Discard to untap bearer or bearer and one other character in his company. Alternatively, discard during organization phase to allow its bearer's company to play an additional region card.

Name: Washed and Refreshed
Text: Playable at the end of the organization phase on a moving company. When the company's new site is revealed, the company may untap a number of characters equal to the number of regions less than four in its site path.

Name: Warm Now Be Heart and Limb
Text: Ritual. Playable on a company during organization phase. Each sage in company that taps may heal one character (from wounded to tapped). Each sage so tapping makes a corruption check.

Name: Vanish in Sunlight!
Text: Modify the prowess of one Nazgul or Undead attack by -2 (by -4 if Gates of Morning is in play).

Name: Valiant Sword
Text: Hoard item. Weapon. +2 to bearer's prowess to a maximum of 9. Warrior only: +1 to body to a maximum of 9.

Name: Twice-baked Cakes
Text: Food. Playable only at a Free-hold [{F}] or Border-hold [{B}]. May also be played if the site is tapped. Discard during organization phase to allow its bearer's company to play two addtional region cards.

Name: Trickery
Text: Scout only against an Orc, Troll, Man, Elf, Slayer, Awakened Plant, or Giant attack against his company. Make a roll (or draw a #); if the result is greater than 5, the attack is cancelled.

Name: Thror's Map
Text: Unique. Lost Knowledge. Discard Thror's Map to untap a site with a Dragon automatic-attack.

Name: Three Golden Hairs
Text: Unique. Playable at any site on a non-Wizard, non-Hobbit diplomat character (other than Galadriel) at the same site as Galadriel. All corruption cards on the bearer are discarded when this card comes into play. +2 to all corruption checks by bearer.

Name: The Riddle Game
Text: Riddling Attempt. Playable during site phase on a character at the same site as one of opponent's companies. Tap the character. Opponent chooses a character from his company to play the riddle game. Each player makes a riddling roll (or draws a #) modified by +2 if his character is a sage and by +1 if a Hobbit (re-roll ties). The player with the highest result wins. He then names two cards and the other player reveals his hand. If any of the named cards are revealed, they are immediately discarded.

Name: Tales of the Hunt
Text: Lore. Playable on a Man at a Border-hold [{B}]; tap the Man. Bearer may tap to untap any character in his company. Bearer makes a corruption check.

Name: Star of High Hope
Text: Environment. The prowess of each Elf and Dunadan is modified by +1 (by +2 if Gates of Morning is in play).

Name: Staff Asunder
Text: Playable on a Wizard bearing Wizard's Staff whose company is facing an attack. Wizard makes a corruption check. Place Wizard's staff in your marshalling point pile. Wizard gains +5 prowess against the attack. Modify the attack's body by -2.

Name: Skin-changer
Text: Only playable on Beorn. Until the end of the turn, his prowess and body are each modified by +2. If Beorn is chosen to be the target of a strike from an attack, he may choose to face a second strike from that attack (he faces a seperate strike sequence for each strike). Beorn makes a corruption check modified by -2 after any attack made against his company. If still in play at the end of the turn, place Beorn in your hand. Any items he bears may be transferred to unwounded characters in his company (no corruption checks are required).

Name: Book of Mazarbul
Text: Unique. Lost Knowledge. Only playable at Moria. May be stored at a Dwarf-hold for 5 marshalling points. If its bearer is a sage, tap Book of Mazarbul during your organization phase to increase your hand size by 1 until your next untap phase.

Name: Blue Mountain Dwarves
Text: Unique. Playable at Blue Mountain Dwarf-hold if the influence check is greater than 9. Standard modifications: Elves (-2), Dwarves (+2).

Name: Secret News
Text: Opponent reveals to you 5 random cards at once from his hand.

Name: Block
Text: Warrior only. Warrior does not tap agains one strike (unless he is wounded by the strike).

Name: Bill the Pony
Text: Unique. Horse. Playable at Bree of Bag End; playable even if the site is tapped. If at a non-Haven site and if his company's size is three of less, you may discard Bill the Pony at the end of his company's turn and replace its site with the nearest Haven [{H}].

Name: Beornings
Text: Unique. Playable at Beorn's House if the influence check is greater than 7. Standard modifications: Men (+1).

Name: Scabbard of Chalcedony
Text: Hoard Item. -1 body to all failed strikes against bearer. Cannot be duplicated on a given character.

Name: Sated Beast
Text: Target ahunt Dragon manifestation is discarded. Alternatively, if Doors of Night is in play, decreases the number of strikes from one Dragon or Drake attack by one (to a minimum of one). This card may also be played during opponent's movement/hazard phase.

Name: Beautiful Gold Ring
Text: Discard Beatiful Gold Ring when tested. If tested, make a roll (or draw a #) to determine which ring card may be immediately played: - The One Ring (12+); - a Dwarven Ring (10, 11, 12+); - a Magic Ring (1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7); - a Lesser Ring (any result).

Name: Riddling Talk
Text: Riddling attempt. Playable on a character whose company is facing an attack of the type listed below. Character makes a roll (or draws a #) modified by: +2 for each sage and +1 for each Hobbit in his company. If the result is greater than: 8 against Dragons and Drakes, 10 against Men and Giants, 12 against Slayers, Awakened Plants, Orcs, Spiders, and Trolls; then name a card and opponent must reveal his hand. If the named card is in opponent's hand, the creature's card is discarded (all of its attacks are cancelled) and the hazard limit against the character's company is decreased by three.

Name: Athelas
Text: A Dunadan can tap and use this item to heal a character in his company (change from wounded to well, character remains tapped). Aragorn II can also tap and use this item to remove a corruption card from a character in his company. Discard after use. {cyan} UEP: A Dunadan can tap and use this item to heal a character in his company (change from wounded to well, character remains tapped). A manifestation of Aragorn II can also tap and use this item to remove a corruption card from a character in his company. Discard after use.

Name: Ash Mountains
Text: Playable at the end of the organization phase on a company containing a ranger. If the company uses region cards for its site path, tap the ranger to move as if the following pairs of regions were adjacent: Dagorlad and Gorgoroth, Horse Plains and Gorgoroth. The company faces an attack at the beginning of its movement/hazard phase: Orcs - 4 strikes with 8 prowess. Otherwise, if the site moved to is in one of the regions listed above, the hazard limit is reduced by 2 (to a minimum of 2). Cannot be duplicated on a given company.

Name: Aeglin
Text: Unique. Playable at Cirith Helkaloke or Steel Fall. Weapon: +3 prowess (to a maximum of 9 or double the bearer's base prowess). Is considered non-unique and Sword of Gondolin for the purpose of Attuning the Blade and Biter and Beater. Elf warrior only: tap: take one Attuning the Blade from your discard pile to your hand.

Name: Wielded Twice
Text: Ritual. Tap a sage to untap an item in his company. Sage makes a corruption check.

Name: Reforging
Text: Sage only during the site phase at an untapped site where Information is playable. Tap the sage and the site. Sage may not untap until Reforging is stored at a Haven [{H}]. During your organization phase, you may tap a sage at a Haven and discard a stored Reforging to retrieve any minor or major weapon, armor, or shield from your discard pile. The item must be placed under the control of a character in the sage's company.

Name: Return of the King
Text: Unique. Aragorn II only. Only playable in Minas Tirith and only if Denethor II is not in play. Aragorn II's direct influence is modified by +3. Keep this card with Aragorn II; discard if he leaves play.

Name: Aiwendil
Text: Unique. Manifestation of Radagast. Playable on a hero company moving through a region in Wilderland or The Northern Waste, if you have not yet revealed an avatar. Characters in the company may play factions and allies as though you were Radagast. You may play spells on the company as if on Radagast (except Sacrifice of Form and True Fana); ignore any required CP. During the movement/hazard phase, if the company moves with at least two Wilderness [w ,w] in their site path, you may bring one resource from your sideboard to your play deck (or three to your discard pile). Discard this card when Radagast enters play, when you bring an avatar into play, you have 10 P or more, or during the movement/ hazard phase if the company does not attempt to move through a Wilderness region.

Name: Anglachel
Text: Unique. Weapon. Playable at Tol Morwen. Elf or warrior only: +1 prowess to a maximum of 10. After every strike bearer faces he must make a CP. Anglachel is considered Anglachel gives 4 corruption points if used as a minion resource. A stored Dark Forges or Reforging may be placed with this item to "restore" it. Once restored, Anglachel gives 5 mp and +5 prowess (to a maximum of 12) and -3 to target's body.

Name: Anguirel
Text: Unique. Weapon. Playable at any Under-deeps Ruins & Lairs [R] with an automatic-attack. Elf or warrior only: +4 prowess and -3 to target's body. For every strike bearer faces he must make a CP (after the attack). Anguirel gives 4 corruption points if used as a minion resource.

Name: Beadmaker's Healing Runeknife
Text: Weapon. Playable only at a Ruins & Lairs [R] in the Northern Waste. Rune item. May only be included with a starting company if it contains a character with a home site in The Northern Waste. tap: give +1 prowess to the bearer against a strike. Sage only: discard this item to give +1 body to the bearer or another character in his company for the rest of the turn or ttap bearer and discard this item to heal another character in his company.

Name: Beadmaker's Hunting Runeknife
Text: Weapon. Playable only at a Ruins & Lairs [R] inThe Northern Waste. Rune item. + 1 prowess to a maximum of 9. Ranger only: tap: force opponent to search his discard pile for a non-unique Animal hazard creature. This creature immediately attacks bearer as though he were a one-character company. tA tap: and discard this item to modify the prowess, body and strikes from a non-unique Animal or Wolf attack by -1 (to a minimum of 1).

Name: Berninga
Text: Unique. Playable at Ligr Wodaize Berne if the influence check is greater than 9. Standard Modifications: Men (+1), Lossoth (-3), Angmarim (-3), any Orc faction (-2). tap: cancel a Bear attack keyed to a region in The Northern Waste against one of your companies, or cancel the effects of Beorning Skin-changers moving through a region in The Northern Waste.

Name: Bone-harpoon
Text: Weapon. Playable only at sites in The Northern Waste. Two- handed. May only be included with a starting company if the company contains a character with a home site in The Northern Waste. Warrior only: +1 prowess to a maximum of 6. -1 body to strikes bearer faces from Wolf and Animal attacks. If bearer is assigned a strike from a Wolf or Animal attack, discard this item to make a roll and add bearer's prowess: if greater than the attack's prowess, the attack is defeated.

Name: Dragon-teeth Necklace
Text: Unique. Treasure. Trophy. Playable at any tapped or untapped site if the company has defeated a manifestation of a unique Dragon or Drake this turn. +2 EI against Dragons, Dwarves, and Men. -4 to bearer's flattery and offering attempts. Cannot be transferred. tap: force a Dwarf at a site in the same region as bearer to make a CP modified by -2; if target Dwarf fails, he attacks the bearer (as if in single character CvCC; ignore any other effects).

Name: Cembereth
Text: Playable at an information site in the Northern Waste. This card can be stored at any site where you played Banishment. The sites becomes a hidden site and never leaves play. You may store hazard creatures/ trophies at this site, and receive 1 mp per such creature/trophy to a maximum of 3 mp. If you receive any mp for this card you may bring a Sentinel of the Grove from your sideboard and place it with this site, regardless of its playability. Sentinel affects all versions of the site, but it's attacks are canceled against your companies. A copy must tap an avatar or ranger to move to any version of this site. Cannot be duplicated on a given site.

Name: Legendary Hoard
Text: Playable on an at home Dragon manifestation. Target Dragon's automatic-attack cannot be cancelled. Rotate this card 90 each time a manifestation of target Dragon is played. If the site receiving the Dragon's automatic-attack is untapped, a number of items played there do not tap the site: not rotated: 1 item; rotated once: 2 items; rotated twice or more: 3 items. If target Dragon is required to be discarded or removed from play, invert Dragon on table until this card is discarded. Discard this card when any item is played at target Dragon's lair that tap the site. Cannot be duplicated on a given Dragon.

Name: Dreams of Beleriand
Text: Lore. Ritual. Playable on a Noldo or Sinda Elf. Each of your Dreams of Lore is considered Lost Knowledge and does not give any mp (not even to a Lord or Fallen-wizard player). Place this card in your mp when target Elf leaves active play. He may play Dreams of Lore at tapped sites, and also at any site in Lindon, Elven Shores, or region adjacent to these (as if a sage). While he moves to such a site, invert this card and discard a Dreams of Lore he controls to take an item playable at his new site from your discard pile to your hand. If inverted, this card gives 1 mp.

Name: King under the Mountain
Text: Unique. Playable on Balin, Dain II, Thorin II, or Thrain II if his company has defeated a unique non-ahunt dragon manifestation other than Earcaraxe. The target Dwarf receives +5 direct influence against Dwarves and Dwarf factions. The the defeated dragon's lair becomes a Border-hold [{B}] and Dwarf-hold for all purposes and has no Dragon automatic-attacks. Only Dwarves may play items at this site.

Name: Elves of Evermist
Text: Unique. Playable at Evermist if the influence check is greater than 12. Standard Modifications: Elves (+1), Elves with a home site in The Northern Waste (+3).Each of your each stored Tear of Yavanna gives +1 mp (even to a Fallen-Alatar or Fallen-Radagast player). tap: untap the Keeper of the Lodge Elf if he is at Evermist.

Name: Elves of Evermist2
Text: Unique. Playable at Evermist if the influence check is greater than 12. Standard Modifications: Elves (+1), Elves with a home site in The Northern Waste (+3).Each of your each stored Tear of Yavanna gives +1 mp (even to a Fallen-Alatar or Fallen-Radagast player). tap: untap the Keeper of the Lodge Elf if he is at Evermist.

Name: Exploring Ever Eastwards
Text: Playable at the end of the organization phase on a moving company. Company may move from a site of origin in one of the following regions to a new site in one of the following regions: East Bay of Forochel, Ekkaia, Elven Shores, Gondalf, Helkear, Hub Uichel, Lindon, Thorenaer, or West Bay of Forochel. The site path is [ccc] and the hazard limit is increased by 2.

Name: Forodwaith
Text: Playable during the organization phase on a company at a site in The Northern Waste containing a character with a home site in The Northern Waste. If the company moves with region movement to another site in The Northern Waste, the site path is [www] and the hazard limit is increased by one.

Name: Friend of the Kelvar
Text: Place this card in your mp . You may place any Animal factions you have in play with this card. If there is a faction with this card, any additional factions must have been played at sites in the same territory. This card gives 2 mp (even to a Thranduil or Fallen-Radagast player) when there are at least four different Animal factions placed with it. Cannot be duplicated by a given player for a given territory.

Name: Friends of Winter
Text: Unique. This card gives 3 mp when you have the Aerfaroth, Helechoth, and Lossoth factions in play. If you receive this card's mp, these factions can only be influenced by an avatar or character with a home site in The Northern Waste, and your characters may play Information resources at any Border-hold [B] in The Northern Waste (as though Information were playable there).

Name: Houses of Healing
Text: Playable on a Free-hold [{F}]. Site becomes a Haven [{H}] for the purposes of healing. Discard Houses of Healing when the site is returned to the location deck or discarded.

Name: Gaerennon
Text: Unique. Armor. Only playable at a Ruins & Lairs [R] in a Coastal Sea [c] region. +2 body to a maximum of 9. Bearer may use Lordly Presence as if he were a diplomat. If bearer is a Sinda, values in parentheses and brackets apply. tap: prevent the discarding of an item by effect of Drowning Seas.

Name: Galgrin's Hammer
Text: Unique. Weapon. Playable at Canadras. Values in parentheses apply to an Umit bearer. +1 prowess. +2 EI against Umli and Men with a home site in The Northern Waste. tap: if bearer is a male sage, Dwarf, or Umit to place a Reforging in the company with an item that can be restored (as if stored).

Name: Hey! come merry dol!
Text: Playable at the end of the organization phase on a moving company. Each Wilderness [{w}] symbol in the company's site path counts as half a Wilderness [{w}]. When calculating the number of Wildernesses [{w}] in such a site path, round down the final result.

Name: Here, There, or Yonder
Text: Tap a character during his site phase at a tapped or untapped Ruins & Lairs [{R}]. Make a roll (or draw a #) modified by +3 if character is a diplomat. An ally may be played and placed under the character's control if the result is greater than 6 plus the ally's mind stat and the ally is not restricted from moving in this site's region. If an ally is played, tap the site if it is not already tapped.

Name: Great Seagull
Text: Unique. Animal. Flying. Playable by a Dunadan, Elf, or Wizard at any tapped or untapped non-Haven, non-Dragon's lair site in a Coastal Sea [c] region in The Northern Waste (or region adjacent). tap: cancel a strike against itself (not from an automatic-attack); tap: force opponent to reveal all hazards from his hand. For either use, the next time Great Seagull would become untapped, make him tapped instead.

Name: Great Song of Awakening
Text: Unique. Playable at Evermist on the Keeper of the Lodge Elf, if Land Reborn has been rotated 360deg. Tap an Elf during the site phase atEvermist and make a roll (+1 for each other Elf tapping in support); if greater than 7 rotate this card 90deg. For each time rotated this card is worth 1 mp and has the following effects (cumulative; maximum of 4) for companies in The Northern Waste: One: Mordo and Morgoth's Ring cannot be played (discard if in play). Two: all creatures keyable to Wilderness [w] or Shadow-land [s]need an extra Wilderness [w] or Shadow-land [s] in the site path to beplayed. Three: all corruption checks from magic cards are modified by extra -2.Four: if your opponent is Durlach, Hoarmurath, Lomaw or The Witch-king you win the game.

Name: Greater Spell-bead
Text: Playable at any non-Dragon's lair Ruins & Lairs [R] in The Northern Waste, if the company discards (for no effect) a Lost Knowledge card it controls. Rune item. +2 EI against characters with a lower mind than bearer. Warrior only: +1 to prowess and body (to a maximum of 10) when facing an Animal, Wolf or Awakened Plant attack. Scout only: tap: bring a scout skill card from your discard pile to your play deck. Diplomat only: tap: give +3 to an influence attempt against an animal, Ent or Man faction playable in the Northern Waste. Bearer makes a CP when this item becomes tapped

Name: Grinding Ice
Text: Environment. For each company moving through Elven Shores or a Coastal Sea [c] region in The Northern Waste, one Coastal Sea [c] in the company's site path becomes a Wilderness [w]. May also be played as a hazard, if a company moves through the above mentioned regions.

Name: Aerfaroth
Text: Unique. Playable at Pieni Satama if the influence check is greater than 8. Standard Modifications: Men (+1), Elves with a home site in the Northern Waste (+1), Dwarves (-1). tap: cancel an attack keyed to East Bay of Forochel or West Bay of Forochel by type or name.

Name: Rescue Prisoners
Text: Playable at an already tapped Dark-hold [{D}] or Shadow-hold [{S}] during the site phase. The company faces a spider attack (2 strikes with 7 prowess). If no characters are untapped after the attack, discard Rescue Prisoners. Otherwise, you may tap 1 character in the company and put Rescue Prisoners under his control. That character may not untap until Rescue Prisoners is stored at a Haven [{H}], Border-hold [{B}], or Free-hold [{F}] during his organization phase. You receive the marshalling points for this card only when it is stored. Cannot be duplicated at a given site.

Name: Lore of the Ages
Text: Lore. Playable on an Elf at a Haven [{H}]; tap the Elf. When facing an attack, bearer may tap to give +1 prowess to all characters in his company against the attack. Bearer makes a corruption check.

Name: Many Foes He Fought
Text: If defender chooses a warrior to be the target of a strike from an attack, that character may choose to face any number of the strikes from that attack. The character suffers a cumulative -1 prowess/-1 body for each additional strike faced. The character faces a separate strike sequence for each strike.

Name: Riders of Rohan
Text: Unique. Playable at Edoras if the influence check is greater than 9. Standard Modifications: Hobbits (+1), Dunedain (+1).

Name: Ringlore
Text: Sage only, only playable at a site where Information is playable, and only if a character in his company has a Gold Ring. Play to test a Gold Ring. No roll (or draw) is used. The player may replace the Gold Ring with any ring from his hand (except for The One Ring). Playable only during site phase. Tap the sage and the site.

Name: Risky Blow
Text: Warrior only against one strike. +3 to prowess and -1 to body.

Name: Roac the Raven
Text: Unique. Flying. Playable at any site in Northern Rhovanion. Tap and discard to attempt to bring any faction into play - treat this influence check as though it were made by a diplomat.

Name: Sacrifice of Form
Text: Spell. Wizard only. All of the strikes from one attack against your Wizard's company fail; +3 to any body checks made to determine if the attack is defeated. Discard the Wizard (i.e. he becomes unrevealed) and any non-item cards he controls. Place any items he controls under his card and keep these off to the side (these items are considered to still be in play). If the Wizard is put back into play, return his items to him and place Sacrifice of Form with him. Wizard receives +1 to his prowess, body and direct influence. May not be duplicated on a given Wizard.

Name: Sapling of the White Tree
Text: Not playable in a Shadow-hold [{S}] or Dark-hold [{D}]. May be stored at Minas Tirith. 2 marshalling points if stored at Minas Tirith.

Name: Scroll of Isildur
Text: Unique. Lost Knowledge. When a Gold Ring is tested in a company with the Scroll of Isildur, the result of the roll (or draw) is modified by +2.

Name: Secret Entrance
Text: Only playable at the end of the organization phase; may not be played on a company that is moving to a site in a Dark-domain [{d}]. Tap a sage in the company, and no hazard creatures keyed to the site may be played on the company.

Name: Secret Passage
Text: Playable only at the end of the organization phase. If the company that it is played on moves to a Ruins & Lairs [{R}] site, opponent may only play hazard creatures that are keyed to the company's site.

Name: Shadowfax
Text: Unique. Horse. Playable at Edoras or Dunharrow. If his company has only one character or one character and a Hobbit at the end of the movement/hazard phase, tap Shadowfax to allow his company to immediately move again; an additional site card may be played and an additional movement/hazard phase follows for that company.

Name: Shield of Iron-bound Ash
Text: Shield. +1 to body to a maximum of 8. Tap Shield of Iron-bound Ash to gain +1 prowess against one strike.

Name: Skinbark
Text: Unique. Ent. Playable at Wellinghall. May not be attacked by automatic-attacks or hazards keyed to his site. discard Skinbark if his company moves to a site that is not in: Fangorn, Rohan, Gap of Isen, Wold & Foothills, Anduin Vales, or Redhorn Gate.

Name: Southrons
Text: Unique. Playable at the Southron Oasis if the influence check is greater than 8. Standard Modifications: Dunedain (-2), Elves (-2), Dwarves (-2). {green} DCE: Add: Standard modifications: Wizards(-5)

Name: Star-glass
Text: Tap Star-glass to cancel an attack by Undead or to modify the prowess of a spiders, animals, or wolves attack by -2. Bearer makes a corruption check.

Name: Stars
Text: Environment. Modify the prowess of one Undead attack by -1. Alternatively, if Gates of Morning is in play, until the end of the turn, treat one Dark-domain [{d}] as a Shadow-land [{s}] or one Shadow-land [{s}] as a Wilderness [{w}]. Cannot be duplicated.

Name: Not at Home
Text: Cancel one Dragon, Drake, or Troll automatic-attack or attack keyed to a site. Alternatively, if Gates of Morning is in play, reduce the number of strikes of any automatic-attack by 2 (to a minimum of one).

Name: Nenselde the Wingild
Text: Unique. Maia. Playable at Dol Amroth. May not be attacked. Tap Nenselde to return one environment resource long-event or short-event from your discard pile to your hand. Discard Nenselde if her company moves to a site that is not in: Belfalas, Bay of Belfalas, Anfalas, or Mouths of the Anduin.

Name: Necklace of Silver and Pearls
Text: Hoard item. Jewel. Discard this card to give +3 direct influence and +5 mind to bearer until the end of the turn. The bearer's additional mind does not use any controlling influence. This item may also be so discarded during opponent's site phase.

Name: More Sense than You
Text: Playable before strikes are assigned on an untapped character or ally whose company is facing an attack. Tap target character or ally. He may not be assigned a strike from this attack.

Name: Men of Lake-town
Text: Unique. Playable at Lake-town if the influence check is greater than 8. Standard Modifcations: Men (+2), Dwarves (-1).

Name: Men of Dale
Text: Unique. Playable at Dale if the influence check is greater than 7. Standard modifications: Men (+2), Dwarves (+1).

Name: Mathom Lore
Text: Lore. Playable on a Hobbit at Bag End; tap the Hobbit. During the organization phase, bearer may tap to choose a minor item from your play deck or discard pile to place into your hand. Reshuffle your play deck if it was used. Bearer makes a corruption check.

Name: Master of Wood, Water, or Hill
Text: Ritual. Tap a sage to change one Wilderness [{w}] to a Border-land [{b}] or Shadow-land [{s}] or one Shadow-land [{s}] to a Wilderness [{w}] or one Border-land [{b}] to a Wilderness [{w}]. Sage makes a corruption check.

Name: Master of Esgaroth
Text: Playable at the end of the organization phase on a moving company. If the company moves to a Border-hold [{B}], it can take a second movement/hazard phase immediately following its first movement/hazard phase.

Name: Marvels Told
Text: Ritual. Tap a sage to force the discard of a hazard non-environment permanent-event or long-event. Sage makes a corruption check modified by -2.

Name: Map to Mithril
Text: Lore. Playable on a Dwarf during the site phase at a site at which "Information" is playable. Tap the Dwarf and site. Tap Map to Mithril if bearer is ever at Moria; this card never untaps. If Map to Mithril is at a Dwarf-hold and it is tapped, the bearer may tap himself and place this card with a non-unique weapon in his company. This gives the weapon a +3 prowess bonus.

Name: Many Turns and Doublings
Text: Ranger only. Cancel an attack by Wolves, Spiders, Animals, or Undead. Alternatively, if Gates of Morning is in play, decrease the hazard limit against the ranger's company by one (no minimum).

Name: Magical Harp
Text: Treasure. Unique. Hoard item. Instrument. Tap Magical Harp to cancel all actions for the rest of the turn that discard a target character in bearer's company. Bearer makes a corruption check. This item may also be so tapped during opponent's site phase.

Name: Wit
Text: Modify one riddling roll by +3. If applicable, this card may also be played during your opponent's site-phase if a riddling roll is called for.

Name: Wizard Uncloaked
Text: Spell. Wizard only. Return all hazard permanent-events on characters in your Wizard's company to opponent's hand. Wizard makes a corruption check modified by -2.

Name: Wizard's Staff
Text: Hoard item. Weapon. Only a Wizard may bear this item. +2 to direct influence and +2 to prowess. +2 to any corruption check required by a spell card. Tap bearer at the beginning of your end-of-turn phase to take one "spell," "ritual," or "light enchantment" from your discard pile into your hand. Bearer makes corruption check. Cannot be duplicated on a given Wizard.

Name: Belegennon
Text: Unique. Hoard item. Armor. +1 body (to a maximum of 9). A stored Reforging may be placed with this item to "restore" it. Once restored, Belegennon gives 4 MP and 3 CP. Warrior only (restored): If bearer chooses not to tap against a strike, he receives no prowess penalty.

Name: Dwarven Ring of Bavor's Tribe
Text: Unique. Dwarven Ring. Playable only with a Gold Ring and after a test indicates a Dwarven Ring. Values in parentheses and brackets apply to a Dwarf bearer. Tap a Dwarf bearer to search your play deck for a greater item playable at the bearer's site. Play this item immediately or discard; reshuffle the play deck. Bearer makes a corruption check modified by +2.

Name: Fair Travels in Dark-domains
Text: Playable at the end of the organization phase if target company plays a new site card. If the site path has at least one Dark-domain [{d}], the hazard limit for the target company decreases by one (or by two if Gates of Morning is in play) to a minimum of two. Cannot be duplicated on the same company.

Name: Interrogation
Text: Stolen Knowledge. Playable during the site phase on a company at a site where an opponent's character is taken prisoner. Only playable as a hero resource if your opponent is a minion player or you have at least 10 P. Cannot be duplicated for a given prisoner. Opponent reveals his hand to you. May be stored at a Haven [H/K]. When it is stored, it gives 2 mp and you may name two cards: if opponent has any of these in his hand, he must discard them (or reveal his hand) and your ring tests are modified by +2 (invert this card).

Name: Fair Travels in Free-domains
Text: Playable at the end of the organization phase if target company plays a new site card. The hazard limit for the target company decreases by one for every Free-domain [{f}] in its site path (to a minimum of two). Cannot be duplicated on the same company.

Name: Fair Travels in Shadow-lands
Text: Playable at the end of the organization phase if target company plays a new site card. If the site path has at least one Shadow-land [{s}], the hazard limit for the target company decreases by one (or by two if Gates of Morning is in play) to a minimum of two. Cannot be duplicated on the same company.

Name: Fair Travels in Wilderness
Text: Playable at the end of the organization phase if target company plays a new site card. The hazard limit for the target company decreases by one for every Wilderness [{w}] in its site path (to a minimum of two). Cannot be duplicated on the same company.

Name: Far-sight
Text: Sage only during the site phase at an untapped site where Information is playable. Tap the sage and the site to search through your play deck and choose an item that you must reveal to your opponent. This item is placed in your hand and the play deck is reshuffled. The sage makes a corruption check.

Name: Favor of the Valar
Text: Unique. Playable during your organization phase. Shuffle your hand and your discard pile into you play deck (site cards remain in the discard pile). Draw a new hand of 8 cards. Remove Favor of the Valar from the game. May not be played by a Dwarf-lord or Elf-lord player.

Name: Fellowship
Text: Only playable at a Haven [{H}] during the organization phase on a company that has four or more characters and allies. +1 to prowess and +1 to corruption checks for all characters and allies inthe company. Discard this card if a character of ally joins or leaves the company for any reason.

Name: Fog
Text: Environment. Playable only if Gates of Morning is in play. Treat all Free-domains [{f}] as Border-lands [{b}] and all Border-lands [{b}] as Wildernesses [{w}] and all Shadow-lands [{s}] as Wildernesses [{w}] and all Dark-domains [{d}] as Shadow-lands [{s}]. Cannot be duplicated.

Name: Ford
Text: Playable only at the end of the organization phase. Tap a ranger to prevent opponent from playing hazard creatures keyed to Wilderness [{w}] against the ranger's company.

Name: Dwarven Ring of Barin's Tribe
Text: Unique. Dwarven Ring. Playable only with a Gold Ring and after a test indicates a Dwarven Ring. Values in parentheses and brackets apply to a Dwarf bearer. Tap a Dwarf bearer to search your play deck for a major item playable at the bearer's site. Play this item immediately or discard; reshuffle the play deck. Bearer makes a corruption check modified by +2.

Name: Mordor in Ruins
Text: Unique. May only be brought into play from sideboard as result of a card that states it must be played; minion players may bring Foundations Remain into play from sideboard or hand, hero players Spies into Mordor. All versions of sites in Gorgoroth and Udun become Ruins & Lairs [R]. Automatic-attacks at these sites as given on the site card become Undead attacks. Unique resources may not be played by minion players at these sites. Any resource that can be stored at Barad-dur must be stored at Minas Morgul instead.

Name: Mordor Rebuilt
Text: All automatic-attacks at sites in Gorgoroth and Nurn receive +1 to their prowess and strikes.

Name: Gates of Morning
Text: Environment. All environment hazard cards in play are immediately discarded, and all hazard environment effects are canceled. Cannot be duplicated.

Name: Durin's Axe
Text: Unique. Weapon.  Two-handed. +2 prowess (+4 if held by a Dwarf) to a maximum of 9. If held by a Dwarf, 4 marshalling points and 3 corruption points.

Name: Glamdring
Text: Unique. Weapon. +3 to prowess to a maximum of 8 (a maximum of 9 against Orcs).

Name: Goldberry
Text: Unique. Maia. Playable at Old Forest. May not be attacked. Tap Goldberry to cancel any effect that would cause her company to return to its site of origin after declaring its movement to a new site. Alternatively, tap Goldberry to cancel one attack against her company keyed to Wilderness [{w}].

Name: Gollum
Text: Unique. Playable at Goblin-gate or Moria. If his company's size is less than three, tap Gollum to cancel one attack against his company keyed to Wilderness [{w}] or Shadow-land [{s}]. Tap Gollum if he is at the same non-Haven site as The One Ring; then both Gollum and The One Ring are discarded.

Name: Fram Wyrmslayer
Text: Unique. Grey Agent. Manifestation of Fram Framson. +3 prowess against Dragons and Drakes. May not be among the starting characters and may only be brought into play at his home site. Agent only: tap: if at a site where an opponent's Dragon faction is in play to face the associated Dragon attack. +1 to any resulting body checks after the attack. If the attack is defeated place the faction in the out of play pile.

Name: Gollum's Fate
Text: Unique. Only playable if The One Ring and Gollum are both at Mount Doom diring the site phase. The One Ring is destroyed and its bearer's player wins. May not be played by a lord player (except for Elrond).

Name: Great Ship
Text: Tap a character in target company during the organization phase to play Great Ship on that company. If company's current site path contains a coastal sea region and no consecutive non- coastal sea regions, until the end of the turn and character in the company may tap to cancel the effects of one hazard that targets the company.

Name: Great-road
Text: Playable only at the end of the organization phase on a company that starts at a Haven [{H}]. Opponent may draw up to twice the normal number of cards for this company during the movement/hazard phase. At the end of the turn, the company may replace its site card with the Haven card at which it began the turn.

Name: Great-shield of Rohan
Text: Unique. Shield. +2 to body to a maximum of 9. Warrior only: tap Great Shield of Rohan to remain untapped against one strike (unless bearer is wounded by the strike).

Name: Gwaihir
Text: Unique. Winged. Playable at Eagles' Eyrie. If his company's size is two or less, you may discard Gwaihir during the organization phase to allow his company to move to any site that is not in a Shadow-land [{s}] or Dark-domain [{d}]; only hazard creatures keyed to the site may be played on a company that moves in this fashion.

Name: Halfling Stealth
Text: Hobbit only. Cancel one strike against the Hobbit.

Name: Ringil2
Text: Unique. Hoard item. Weapon. +1 body. Warrior only: +1 prowess (to a maximum of 8). A stored Reforging may be placed with this item to "restore" it. Once restored, Ringil gives 4 MP, 3 CP and +5 prowess (to a maximum of 11).

Name: Halfling Strength
Text: Hobbit only. The Hobbit may untap or he may move from wounded status to well and untapped during his organization phase or he may receive a +4 modification to one corruption check.

Name: Horn der Herausforderung
Text: Unique. Hoard item. Instrument. +2 direct influence. A stored Reforging may be placed with this item to "restore" it. Once restored, Horn der Herausforderung gives 3 MP and 2 CP. If its bearer is the first to face a strike, that character may choose to face all strikes of an attack. The character faces a separate strike sequence for each strike.

Name: Contested Powers of Mirkwood
Text: Quest. Only playable in lieu of playing a minor itemwith a starting company; any player may bring Contested Powers of Mirkwood into play from their sideboard. Cannot be duplicated by a given player. Tap a unique faction you have in play at a site in Mirkwood or its adjacent regions to take one Clean the Greenwood, Pass the Doors of Dol Guldur, Towers Destroyed, or a Stolen Knowledge resource from your sideboard to your hand; then flip this card.

Name: Shoot in the Eye
Text: Information. Warrior only. Playable on a Dwarf, Orc, orMan warrior during the site phase at The Wind Throneor any Dragon's Lair. Tap the character and the site. When facing a Dragon in CvCC its body is halved (round up). Discard this card after a Dragon has been defeated by the company in CvCC, or if a dark enchanment is played on target character. Cannot be duplicated on a given character.

Name: The Iron Crown
Text: Unique. Whenever bearer makes an influence check, he must also make a corruption check. If the bearer is not a Hobbit: he receives +1 to body to a maximum of 10; he receives +4 to direct influence; and he may tap The Iron Crown to cancel an attack by Orcs, Trolls, or Men against his company.

Name: More Alert than Most (p)
Text: The number of strikes of any attack that chooses defending characters is reduced by one (to a minimum of one) - by two if Gates of Morning is in play. Discard when such attack is defeated. Cannot be duplicated.

Name: Black Arrow
Text: Warrior only. Tap Black Arrow to give -1 to the prowess and body of any one attack against bearer's company. When Black Arrow is tapped, discard it if its bearer is not a Man. {green} DCE: Replace with: Warrior only. Tap Black Arrow to give -1 to the prowess and body of any one attack against bearer's company or to a strike in CvCC against bearer's company. When Black Arrow is tapped, discard it if its bearer is not a Man.

Name: Dwarven Ring of Durin's Tribe
Text: Unique. Dwarven Ring. Playable only with a Gold Ring and after a test indicates a Dwarven Ring. Values in parentheses and brackets apply to a Dwarf bearer. Tap a Dwarf bearer to untap the site he is currently at. Bearer makes a corruption check modified by +2.

Name: Dragon Marked in Red
Text: Quest. Only playable in lieu of playing a minor item with a starting company; any player may bring Dragon Marked in Red into play from his sideboard. When you play a unique item at a site in Withered Heath or its adjacent regions, you may take one Information resource, unique Dragon manifestation, or hoard minor item from your discard pile or sideboard to your hand; then flip this card. Cannot be duplicated by a given player.

Name: Dwarven Ring of Dwalin's Tribe
Text: Unique. Dwarven Ring. Only playable with a Gold Ring and after a test indicates a Dwarven Ring. Values in parentheses and brackets apply to a Dwarf bearer. Tap a Dwarf bearer to search through your play deck for a major item playable at the bearer's site. Play this item immediately or discard; reshuffle the play deck. Bearer makes a corruption check modified by +2.

Name: Dwarven Ring of Thelor's Tribe
Text: Unique. Dwarven Ring. Playable only with a Gold Ring and after a test indicates a Dwarven Ring. Values in parentheses apply to a Dwarf bearer. Tap a Dwarf bearer to search your play deck and/or discard pile for any one or two minor items; place these items in your hand and reshuffle your play deck. Bearer makes a corruption check modified by +2.

Name: Dwarven Ring of Thrar's Tribe
Text: Unique. Dwarven Ring. Playable only with a Gold Ring and after a test indicates a Dwarven Ring. Values in parentheses apply to a Dwarf bearer. Tap a Dwarf bearer to search your play deck and/or discard pile for any one or two minor items; place these items in your hand and reshuffle your play deck. Bearer makes a corruption check modified by +2.

Name: Ear in the King's Court
Text: Stolen Knowledge. Playable on a Dwarf, Elf, or Dunadan at the same site as opponent's Return of the King Aragorn II, The Elf-king Elf, or Lord of Dwarrowdelf -or King under the Mountain Dwarf. May also be played on one of your face-up agents. While he is at the same site as one of the above named characters: Information is considered playable at the site, and opponent's influence attempts at the site are modified by -3. Cannot be duplicated on a given character or agent.

Name: Dwarven Ring of Druin's Tribe
Text: Unique. Dwarven Ring. Playable only with a Gold Ring and after a test indicates a Dwarven Ring. Values in parentheses and brackets apply to a Dwarf bearer. Tap a Dwarf bearer to search your play deck for a greater item playable at the bearer's site. Play this item immediately or discard; reshuffle the play deck. Bearer makes a corruption check modified by +2.

Name: Eagle-mounts
Text: Playable only at the end of the organization phase on a company with a diplomat that begins the turn at Eagles' Eyrie. Company may move with flying movement to any site that is not a Shadow-hold [{S}] or a Dark-hold [{D}] and is in the same or adjacent region as the comany's current site. Opponent may only play hazard creatures that are keyed to the company's site.

Name: Earth of Galadriel's Orchard
Text: Unique. Only playable at Lorien. 2 marshalling points if stored at Bag End.

Name: Easterlings
Text: Unique. Playable at Easterling Camp if the influence check is greater than 9. Standard modifications: Dunedain (-2).

Name: Elf-song
Text: Song. When Elf-song comes into play, each character at a Haven may immediately remove one corruption card. While Elf-song is in play, no character at a Haven may be discarded or returned to its owner's hand for any reason.

Name: Elf-stone
Text: +2 to direct influence used agains an Elf character or an Elf faction. May not be duplicated on a given character.

Name: Elven Cloak
Text: Tap Elven Cloak to cancel one strike against bearer; the strike must be keyed to Wilderness [{w}]. May not be duplicated on a given character.

Name: Gold beyond Price and Count
Text: Whenever you defeat a Dragon attack, rotate this card 90deg and rotate any Use with Terrible Effect in play back 90deg. For each time rotated, Dragon and Drake attacks against your companies receive -1 to their prowess. If fully rotated, this card gives 2 mp, and you suffer no reduction in item mp if those are more than half of your total mp at the end of the game.

Name: Schwertmeister
Text: Sage only. Playable on an untapped sage at an untapped site where Information is playable during site phase. Tap the site and the sage. Gives the sage warrior skill. If the sage is already a warrior, he can use two weapons (both modifiers count). If he uses two weapons, he can not use a shield. Cannot be duplicated on a given character.

Name: Great Falcons of Mirkwood
Text: Unique. Flying. Playable at Mountains of Mirkwood if the influence check is greater than 9. Standard Modifications: none. Cannot be influenced by an overt character. tap: cancel an attack from a non-unique hazard creature keyed to a region of Mirkwood (by name or single region type) against one of your non-overt companies.

Name: Elves of Lindon
Text: Unique. Playable at Grey Havens if the influence check is greater than 9. Standard Modifications: Dunedain (+1), Elves (+2).

Name: Ent-draughts
Text: Food. Only playable at Wellinghall in addition to an ally or faction that has been successfully played at Wellinghall this turn (even if Wellinghall is already tapped). +1 to prowess. This item may not be stolen, transferred, or stored. May not be duplicated on a given character.

Name: Ents of Fangorn
Text: Unique. Playable at Wellinghall if the influence check is greater than 9. Standard Modifications: Hobbits (+4).

Name: Escape
Text: Cancels an attack against a company. One character of your choice in the company is wounded (no body check is required).

Name: Fair Gold Ring
Text: Discard Fair Gold Ring when tested. If tested, make a roll (or draw a #) to determine which ring card may be immediately played: - The One Ring (11, 12+); - a Dwarven Ring (9, 10, 11, 12+); - a Magic Ring (1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6); - a Lesser Ring (any result).

Name: Fair Sailing
Text: Playable at the end of the organization phase if target company plays a new site card. The hazard limit for the target company decreases by one for every Coastal Sea [{c}] in its site path (to a minimum of two). Cannot be duplicated on the same company.

Name: Zwergenaxt
Text: Weapon. Warrior only. +2 prowess (to a maximum of 7); +3 prowess if held by a Dwarf (to a maximum of 8).

Name: Fair Travels in Border-lands
Text: Playable at the end of the organization phase if target company plays a new site card. The hazard limit for the target company decreases by one for every Border-land [{b}] in its site path (to a minimum of two). Cannot be duplicated on the same company.

Name: Hauberk of Bright Mail
Text: Armor. Warrior only: +2 to body to a maximum of 9.

Name: Dunlendings
Text: Unique. Playable at Dunnish Clan-hold if the influence check is greater than 9. Standard Modifications: Men (-1), Dunedain (-1), Dwarves (-1).

Name: Healing Herbs
Text: Food. The bearer discard this item to heal a character in his company, changing the character's status from wounded to well and untapped. Alternatively, the bearer can tap and discard this item to untap a character that is not wounded.

Name: Magic Ring of Words
Text: Magic Ring. Playable only with a Gold Ring and after a test indicates a Magic Ring. Gives the bearer diplomat skill. If the bearer is already a diplomat, he gets +3 to direct influence. May not be duplicated on a given character.

Name: Men of Anfalas
Text: Unique. Playable at Lond Galen if the influence check is greater than 8. Standard Modifications: Dunedain (+1).

Name: There's Queer Folk About2
Text: When you store a Stolen Knowledge card (to a maximum of twice per turn), place it with this card, rotate this card 90deg, and rotate any other There's Queer Folk About back 90deg; you may take An Untimely Whisper or Secret News from your sideboard or discard pile to your hand. If this card is fully rotated, it gives 3 mp.

Name: Men of Anorien
Text: Unique. Playable at Minas Tirith if the influence check is greater than 7. Standard Modifications: Dunedain (+1).

Name: Men of Dorwinion
Text: Unique. Playable at Shrel-Kain if the influence check is greater than 6. Standard Modifications: Men (+1).

Name: Men of Lamedon
Text: Unique. Playable at Vale of Erech if the influence check is greater than 7. Standard Modifications: Dunedain (+1).

Name: Men of Lebennin
Text: Unique. Playable at Pelargir if the influence check is greater than 7. Standard Modifications: Dunedain (+1).

Name: Men of Northern Rhovanion
